Doña Katherine para ayudar a su marido a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual recorre por toda la ciudad tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora es más fresco. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva 4 años en este negocio el cual le ha ayudado ya que su esposo no gana mucho y tiene muchos gastos son muchos con su nuevo bebé.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y  uniformes para escuelas que es lo que más se vende actualmente. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener a su bebé y que todo salga bien.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank La Dolorosa del Pueblito meets every other week in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its craftsmanship, famous national and internationally. This place is also known for its famous straw hats. 

The group is made up of 12 women and 2 men who decided to get together some time ago and start this Communal Bank that has helped them a lot. Thanks to the loans, they have been able to improve their small businesses and their quality of life. They work in different activities, such as sales, services and food sales, among others. One of the group members is Katherine. She is a 20-year old woman who lives with her partner, has a 4-year old son and is currently 8 months pregnant with her second child. Her husband works in a factory. 

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Katherine sells all kind of clothes door to door and tours the city three days per week. She normally sells in the mornings, when the weather is cooler. She gives credit to her clients and gets paid in 8 days. She started this business 4 years ago and it has been very helpful given that her husband does not earn a lot and they have a lot of expenses with the new baby. She will use the loan to buy goods such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and school uniforms, which are currently the best sellers. 

This is her fifth cycle with the Communal Bank and she likes it for the easiness in getting the loans. Her dream is to have her baby and that everything will go well.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and school uniforms.

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Goharik is from Qarakert village of Armavir region. Together with her husband, she is involved in cattle breeding. They keep two cows, two mother pigs, 26 little pigs and 30 chickens. The gathered milk and meat is sold locally, and this is the only source of income for their family.

 As there is a high unemployment rate in the region, it is very difficult for Goharik and her husband find a job and sustain the family with additional income. So agriculture is the only source that helps them to have stable income during the month, and they would like to enlarge their farming business. This is the reason why Goharik has applied for this loan. With the loan's help she will purchase a pig, fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation. This will help them to get involved in land cultivation and gather harvest. Goharik hopes that her hard work one day will make her dreams come true, and she will be able to have a big farm and comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a pig, fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation.

loans.name: Khulan

texts.en:
Borrower Ms. Khulan is 36 years old and a married woman. She lives with her family in an outer ger (Mongolian housing tent) district, which lacks the basic infrastructure of the city. She supports her family by operating a souvenir stall business at the outer business area of the city. Currently, she has 1,800,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) in working capital. 

Her business is in its high shopping season since it's the graduation season and also International Children's Day and others. She usually sells stuffed animal toys and other souvenirs. She really wants to increase her working capital by this high shopping season. Thus, she is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more souvenirs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of sandals, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of ingredients to make soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of tomatoes and peppers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a farmer and also has a quarry business that he runs. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy some equipment that will enable him to work well in his quarry. 

Samuel has an incomplete house , and he plans to use part of the loan to purchase building materials to complete his house. He repaid his previous loan on time.

He hopes to be able to expand his quarry business and increase his farm output in the near future.

loans.use: To buy building materials and equipment for quarry work.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a single man, who is 24 years old. He sells phones and phone accessories, a business he has done for the past two years. He has been earning a monthly income of KES 12,000 in this business. He also repairs mobile phones, to supplement his income. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET  LTD, after having repaid the previous loan successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy more phones and phone accessories. With the anticipated profit from his businesses, he will plough back into the business. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a big piece of land and construct a residential house, and to start a family.

loans.use: to buy more phones and phone accessories to resell

loans.name: Flor Maribel

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus dos hijos,  a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Flor no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Pedagogía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Guiso de Pallares para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Flor trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Flor se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, menestras, golosinas y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para abastecer su negocio y atender a mas clientes, así pues Flor seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Flor, age 36, lives in the city of Ica with her two children.  She loves them, and they are her main reason for living.  She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She puts all of her efforts into getting her family ahead because she is father and mother to her children.  Sadly, due to lack of financial resources and the need she had to work ever since she was very young, Flor was not able to study for a professional career in education as she wished to do.  In her free time she likes to relax listening to music.  Sometimes she makes the delicious ‘Guiso de Pallares’ [a type of bean stew] to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with great determination and dedication, Flor works in her small business selling groceries.  She works every day for approximately ten hours.  She believes that it is going well for her because of the good prices and the kind way that she treats her customers.

Flor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to her, she will be able to buy a greater quantity of groceries like rice, sugar, milk, oil, beans, candy, and others.  These will be very useful in stocking her business and tending to more customers.  This way Flor will continue working and putting forth great effort in order to fulfill her big dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Raquel De Mercedes

texts.es:
Raquel Mercedes de 31 años de edad casada, con un hijo menor edad, originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del  país. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal; en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar con su pequeño hijo de actividades recreativas como ir al parque, al cine y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 

Gracia s su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una farmacia ubicada en un lugar específico de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en material de construcción como zinc, cemento, bloques, arena, cal, madera, perlines, para reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que se acerca el invierno y necesita brindarle seguridad y comodidad a su pequeño y familia. Raquel Mercedes agradece la ayuda  que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Raquel Mercedes, 31, is married and has a minor child. She is a native of Leon, a place that is located in the western part of the county.  She is known to be a hardworking and responsible woman who has a desire for personal success.  In her spare time, she enjoys recreational activities with her small son, such as going to the park, to the movies, and spending quality time with him.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she has had to work ever since she was very young to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her spirit and desire to get ahead, she has a pharmacy business that is located in her town.  Her goal for this loan is to invest in construction materials such as: corrugated metal roofing material, cement, cement blocks, sand, lime, wood and beams to repair the roof of her house, because winter is coming and she needs to provide comfort and security to her little one and her family.  Raquel Mercedes appreciates the assistance that the Kiva lenders provide to low-income people in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing material, cement, cement blocks, sand, lime, wood and beams to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Doris Janette

texts.es:
Doris Janett de 23 años de edad, madres solteras con dos hijos de 8,4 años de edad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar mucho de actividades recreativas con sus pequeños hijos Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no puedo cursar una carrera universitaria y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad.

Gracias a su espiritud y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de calzado, sandalias, deportivos, de cuero. De mujer de niños de varón. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. El objetivo de crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de calzado variado, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Doris Janette agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
23-year-old Doris Janette is a single mother with two children who are 8 and 4 years old.  She is from León, in the west of the country.  In her free time, she really enjoys taking part in recreational activities with her young children.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, Doris Janette was unable to study for a degree because she had to work from a young age.

Thanks to her strong spirit and her desire to make progress in life, Doris Janette runs a footwear business selling men's, women's and children's sandals, sneakers and leather shoes.  She works around 10 hours a day.  Doris Janette's business is located in one of her town's markets.  Her aim for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with a variety of footwear so that, in the not-so-distant future, she can make better income.  Doris Janette is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders are giving to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, enabling them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her footwear business with men's, women's and children's sandals, sneakers and leather shoes

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is single and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. She sells groceries in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Agatha uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Agatha will use the loan to purchase a larger amount of groceries for inventory, which will help her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agatha plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase a larger amount of groceries for inventory, which will help her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Elizabeth Adjoa

texts.en:
Elizabeth is divorced and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Elizabeth is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells "banku" for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She normally sells her "banku" in Wiomoah (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about four years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Elizabeth uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a widow with 2 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. She sells groceries in Wiomoah, near Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this for about 2 years. 

As the sole wage earner, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to buy increased amounts of groceries, helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to diversify the types of products that she is selling, enabling her to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to buy increased amounts of groceries

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a small-scale oats and bread seller in Wiomoah (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education as she is a primary school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Ekua has been working as an oats and bread seller for close to two years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of oats and bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying an oats and bread stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of oats and bread

loans.name: Aunty Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Aunty Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking ingredients, in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Aunty Aba is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Aunty Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients. In the long term, Aunty Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, which will help her to expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients

loans.name: Altantur

texts.en:
Mr. Altantur, 42 years old, lives with his wife and 2-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He worked in Korea on an employment contract from 1999 to 2000 and came back to Mongolia in order to begin his tourism business with a Korean business partner. But in 2012, his business partner, who is Korean, gave up on this business because of a health issue. 

Now, Altantur is employed by a USA invested company as a sales manager. His main duty is to meet with customers at home and introduce his products. He drives around the city a lot, and his automobile is his main tool for his job. The automobile he uses has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase automobile spare parts. Using these spare parts, he can repair his automobile, thus ensuring his sustainable employment. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is eager to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase automobile spare parts for the automobile he uses for his work.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a married man, aged 32 years, and blessed with two children ages six and two years old. Benard offers motorcycle services in Koibatek and has been in operation for a period of six years earning an income of KES. 15,000.

He is now servicing his third loan of KES. 70,000 with KADET LTD and wishes to purchase motorcycle spare parts and pay other repairs for the motorbike.  The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and also save the rest for future developments.

His dream is to live happily and prosper in his business.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of pepper, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: G.s Los Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
G.S los comerciantes  esta conforma por tres personas, dos hombre y una mujer. Padres y madres responsables con 7 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser personas, responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar, y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde muy temprana edad. Ellos luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos, y formarlos profesionalmente.
Marlyn es la coordinadora del G.S Los Comerciantes y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva variada como pantalones, camisas, faldas, short, camisolas,  ropa interior, jugos de sabanas, toallas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en  unos de  los mercados de la localidad. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10  horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de ropa nueva, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El  grupo solidario Los Comerciante agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Los Comerciantes communal bank is comprised of three people, two men and one woman.  They are responsible fathers and mothers who have seven children under their care.  They are from Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the country.  They are known for being responsible and hard-working people with the desire to get ahead.  Sadly, they were not able to go to school, and at a very young age they were compelled to start working.  Every day they struggle in order to give their children a better future and for them to be trained professionally.  

Marlyn is the coordinator of Los Comerciantes communal bank.  Her business is selling various new clothes like pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, camisoles, underwear, sheet sets, and towels.  Her business is located at one of the local markets.  She works in her business some ten hours a day by offering her products to fixed and casual customers.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business by purchasing new clothes.  She will do so in order to be able to get better income in the not so distant future.

The Los Comerciantes communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of working.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, camisoles, underwear, sheet sets, and towels.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela de 58 años de edad, casada, con hijos mayores de edad e independiente. Ella es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ángela se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora a pesar que sus hijos son mayores, siempre le gusta tener el medio de trabajo para no depender de ellos económicamente. Y poder sentirse realizada e independiente.
Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general  pantalones, blusas, cosméticos, rubor, crema entre otros. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Angela is 58 years old, married and has children who are all now independent adults.  Angela is originally from León, in the west of the country.  She is hard-working and responsible and has a great desire to move ahead in life.  She has always been a feisty woman and, while her children are now adults, she still prefers to earn her own living so that she does not have to depend on them financially.  She wants to feel accomplished and independent.

Thanks to her strong spirit and her will to prosper, Angela makes a living selling general merchandise such as trousers, blouses, cosmetics, blusher, creams and more.  She works eight hours per day and enjoys her work.  Angela aims to use this loan in to invest in and stock up her business by buying merchandise so that, in the near future, she will be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to invest in and stock up her business where she sells merchandise such as trousers, blouses, make-up, blusher, creams and more.

loans.name: Ekuwah

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekuwah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 1 year. Ekuwah is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer. 

The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ekuwah wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Ekuwah plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish

loans.name: Papa

texts.en:
Even though Papa grew up in poverty and without an education, he has been able to fulfill his dream of achieving a better life for himself and his family. Currently, Papa is an entrepreneur. He sells charcoal in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). His business enterprise has grown substantially since he began, five years ago. He uses the income from his business to help his wife raise their four children.

Papa has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for his product. Nevertheless, he is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Therefore, he aims to use his loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Papa wants to buck the trend, by ensuring that all his children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ekuwah

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Ekuwah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched, powdered cassava). She usually sells her Gari in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling Gari for three years. Ekuwah is married and has 10 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Ekuwah wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory level. As a result, she will be able to sell more of her tasty Gari. In the long term, Ekuwah plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, which will enable her to expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory level

loans.name: Yohana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yohana del Carmen de 35 años de edad, madres solteras con tres hijos menores de edad, bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gustas disfrutar con sus hijos de tiempo de calidad, y le prepara comida típica de la región como es ¨gallo pinto¨ lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubira gustado mucho estudiar enfermería profesional. 


Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles, jugos,  gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio  unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Yohanna del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Yohana Del Carmen, age 35, is a single mother with three minor children under her care.  She is from León, which is located in the western part of the country.  In her free time she likes to enjoy quality time with her children, and she makes them food that is typical of the region like ‘gallo pinto’ [rice and beans].  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources, she was not able to enroll in the university.  However, she would have really liked to have studied for a nursing career.

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead, she has a food store in her home.  It is a small store that sells food products in small quantities.  She sells packets of coffee, packets of shampoo, rice, cooking oil, sugar, milk, bread, beans, juices, and soft drinks.  She spends some ten hours a day selling her products.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital in order to stock her store with food products.  She will do this so that she will be able to get better income in the not so distant future.

Yohana Del Carmen is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of earning a living.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Guillermo Ramon

texts.es:
Guillermo Ramón de 49 años de edad, soltero con dos hijos mayores de edad. Él es originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Él se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadoras, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económicos, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de Salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de marisco, por encargo y entrega a los clientes fijos y eventuales, el dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diaria, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de marisco el cual se están ofreciendo a buen precio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Guillermo Ramón agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Guillermo Ramón is 49 years old, single and has two adult children.  He is originally from León, which is in the west of the country.  Guillermo is hard-working, responsible and has a desire to move ahead in life.  Unfortunately he was never able to study at university, due to a lack of money, and was forced to work from an early age.

Thanks to his efforts and his desire to move head in life, Guillermo works selling sea food.  He receives orders and fulfills them for both regular and one-time customers, working around eight hours each day.  Guillermo enjoys his work.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock up his business by buying seafood.  He sells it on at a good price so that, in the not-so-distant future, he will be able to improve his income.  Guillermo is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders are giving to people with little resources and to poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that people can have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital by buying seafood so sell to regular and one-off customers.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessenia del Carmen de 37 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Es originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar mucho en compañia de su pequeño hijo. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria pero, le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar bioanalis clínico. Lo cual luchar día a día para ayudar y brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica l venta de cosméticos como crema de cuerpo, pintura labiales, colonias de niños, rubor, lápiz de ojos, sombras, shampoo, talco, pintura de unas entre otros. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Yessenia del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Yessinia del Carmen is 37 years old and the single mother of a minor son. She came originally from Managua, located in the country's central region. In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her small son. Sadly, for lack of economic resources, she could not pursue a university career. But she would have liked to study clinical bio-analysis. For that reason, she must struggle daily in order to assist and offer her son a better future.

Thanks to her spirit and desire to get ahead, Yessinia's economic activity is selling cosmetics such as body cream, lip stick, children's colognes, blush, eye pencils and shadow, shampoo, talcum powder, and nail polish, among other items. Yessinia dedicates at least 10 hours a day to her business. The purpose of her loan is to invest in new inventory for her business, so that in the near future, she may earn better income. 

Yessinia del Carmen is grateful for the help offered by Kiva lenders to people of scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, helping provide a worthy source of work.

loans.use: to invest in buying and selling cosmetics such as skin cream, perfume, lip stick, base, blush, eye liner, and talcum powder.

loans.name: Benturas Douglas

texts.es:
Bentura Douglas de 43 años de edad, casado con tres hijos el cual uno está estudiando y está bajo su responsabilidad. Es originario de León lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Él se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable con gana de superación personal; lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económica, y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad.

Gracia  a su espíritu y sus ganas de Salir adelante tiene por actividad económica servicio de reparación de aparatos eléctricos como televisores, abanicos, computadoras, radios, equipo de sonidos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar piezas y repuestos eléctricos para brindar un mejor servicio como cables, transistores, parlantes, pantallas, desarmadores, tornillos, caja de herramientas, pistola para soldar.  Bentura Douglas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Bentura Douglas is 43 years old and married with three children.  One child is still in school and so under his care.  Bentura is originally from León is the west of the country.  He is hard-working and responsible, and has a desire to move ahead in life.  Unfortunately he was not able to study at university, due to a lack of financial resources, and was forced to work from a young age.

Thanks to his strong spirit and his desire to get ahead in life, Bentura makes a living by repairing electrical appliances such as television sets, fans, computers, radios and sound equipment.  He runs the business out of a room in his home and works around ten hours per day.  The loan will be invested in buying electrical parts such as cables, transistors, speakers, screens, screwdrivers, screws, tool boxes and soldering irons in order to offer better service.  Bentura is grateful to Kiva lenders who are providing people of little resources and poor countries, such as Nicaragua, with the opportunity of having a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy electrical parts such as cables, transistors, speakers, screens, screwdrivers, screws, tool boxes and soldering irons.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Even though Janet grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Janet is an entrepreneur. She sells plastic bowls in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began it a year ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. Janet has identified growing demand among consumers for her products. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs because of her limited inventory. She aims to use her loan to buy more plastic bowls to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet wants to buck the trend and ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tools, thus helping him to improve his total sales.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Gifty did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Gifty sells maize in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 1 year. She is married to an herbalist, and together they have 5 children. Gifty uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Gifty will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Gifty wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels and sell more groceries.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer está conformado por 8 integrantes, madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsalidad. Son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras responsables, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente con escasos recursos económicos, y luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus clientes. 
La coordinadora del banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer es Rosario del Carmen es la coordinadora del banco y tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos,  el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y dedica unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre  como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn") communal bank is made up of eight members. They are single mothers who have a total of twenty children under their care. They are from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the country. They are characterized as hardworking, responsible people who have a desire to improve. Unfortunately, they lack financial resources and they fight every day to give their clients a better future.

The coordinator of the Nuevo Amanecer communal bank is Rosario del Carmen, who has a "pulpería" located in her home. A pulpería is a small store which sells food products in small quantities, such as coffee packets, shampoo packets, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, and juice. Her business is located in her house and she offers her products for about 12 hours per day. She will use this loan to invest in working capital and to stock her business by purchasing merchandise, so that she can have a better income in the not-so-distant future.

The Nuevo Amanecer communal bank is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders offer to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with goods such as coffee packets, shampoo packets, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, and juice.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 36-year-old farmer who is married to Nelson, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been running her dairy farm for the past seven years, producing a monthly income of KES 11,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying her previous loan successfully. Susan will use the loan to buy animal feed and build a cow shed for her cattle. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will improve her family's standard of living. She hopes to venture into poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and build a cow shed for her cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels, thus allowing him to sell more charcoal.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cassava, in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Ama is married and has nine children. Her husband works as a blacksmith. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees.

Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of cassava, which will help her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of cassava to resell

loans.name: Gricelda María

texts.es:
La Señora. Gricelda forma parte del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito desde hace 2 años, en este tiempo a unido aun mas los lasos de amistad con todas sus compañeras y amigas del grupo, le gusta la banca comunal por que los créditos le permiten invertir en sus negocios y continuar creciendo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora. 

La Señora. Griselda tiene 53 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos, su primer hijo está casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo es soltero y trabaja para solventar sus gastos personales, su ultima hija esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como agente vendedor, aun no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Griselda se dedica a la elaboración y venta de confitería, vende maní de dulce y de sal, y  habas tostadas. Lleva 3 años en el negocio y le va muy bien. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de maní, habas, azúcar, sal y aceite para la elaboración de sus productos.

Su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gricelda has been part of the Buscando el Éxito communal bank for two years, during which time she has formed bonds of friendship with all of her fellow group members. She likes the communal bank because the loans allow her to invest in her businesses and continue growing. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate. It is the third most important economic city in the country. Since 1999, Cuenca has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The local people are friendly, kind and hardworking.

Gricelda, 53, is married with three children. Her oldest son is married and lives independently. Her middle son is single and works to cover his personal expenses. Her youngest daughter is studying at a high school in the city. Her husband works as a sales agent. She still does not have her own home, so she rents one.

Gricelda makes and sells sweets. She sells sweet and salty peanuts and toasted beans. She has had this business for three years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of peanuts, beans, sugar, salt, and oil to make her products. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, beans, sugar, salt, and oil.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a widow and has eight children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Comfort is a successful businesswoman. To earn a living, she prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She normally sells her Kenkey in Enyan Kokodo (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Comfort uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Comfort will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will help her to improve her overall sales of Kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will help her to improve her overall sales of kenkey

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline is 30 years old, married to Fredrick and they have seven children who are in school.

She has a grocery which she has operated for the past thirteen years in Nakuru. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables from farmers. She repaid her previous loan successfully. With the anticipated profit, she plans to open a general store.

 In the near future Seline hopes to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more  stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Natividad Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora Natividad está realizando su tercer crédito en el banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora.
 
La Señora Natividad tiene 58 años, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos mayores de edad, casados que viven independientes.

Doña Natividad se dedica a la elaboración de chales y es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos en su tiempo libre, la mayor parte de su tiempo se dedica a su ganado del cual vende la leche que obtiene.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera.

Su meta es tener más ganado y de una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Natividad has applied for her third loan with the Buscando el Éxito communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate. Cuenca is the third most important economic center in the country, and it has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1999. Its people are friendly, kind, and hardworking.

Natividad, 58, is a widow, but she has five children from her marriage. They are all adults who are married and live independently.

Natividad makes shawls and sells clothing and cosmetics in her free time. She dedicates most of her time to her cattle, and she sells the milk they produce.

Her goal is to have more and better-quality livestock.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 43 years old, comes from Nyandarua South, and is married with four children who are aged between 13 years and nine years old.

Bilha has a farming business which she has been running for many years and she has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy some fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 35 years old, married, and supports a family of seven. She has been running a retail shop for the last 13 years, getting a monthly income of KES.28,000.

She learnt about KADET LTD from one of her regular customers, who is registered and has already been funded by KADET LTD. With a loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD, Agnes plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products, e.g., soft drinks, tea leaves, sugar, and wheat and maize flour for sale.


The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 53 years old, married to Sammy, and supports a family of ten members. She operates a large clothing outlet in Bomet town that deals with the sale of school uniform and cultural outfits.

She is a long serving Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) client who was introduced to them by a colleague. She has acquired an emergency loan of 70,000 KES which will be used to pay for a new premises.

The proceeds will be used for business expansion as well as for catering to the family's basic needs. Her hope is to enlarge her business into a highly profitable outlet.

loans.use: to pay for a new premises.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 38-year-old farmer, married to Mishek, a businessman. They are blessed with one child. Mercy has been running her dairy farm for the past two years with a monthly income of KES. 11,000 which she uses to sustain her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after she was introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mercy will use the loan to buy animal feed and build a cow shed for her cattle. 


With the anticipated profits from the business, she will improve the living standards of her family. She hopes to venture into horticultural farming.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and build a cow shed

loans.name: Nancy Imelda

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy está realizando su tercer crédito en el banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora.
 
La Señora. Nancy tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 6 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su último hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad, pero su emoción más grande es porque se encuentra esperando la llegada de su cuarto hijo ya que esta de 6 meses de gestación. Su esposo se dedica a un negocio que es de su propiedad, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa ya que nunca se descuida de sus hijos, por el momento se dedica a trabajar desde su casa y está tejiendo chompas, bufandas y gorras de lana, esta realizando esta actividad ya que se está cuidando debido a su embarazo. Por el momento también está siguiendo un curso de cocina.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de lana para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su meta es tener una cafetería.
texts.en:
Nancy is requesting her third loan with the Buscando el Éxito community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate and is the third most important city economically in the country.  In December 1999 it became a Cultural World Heritage site.  Its people are friendly, kind, and hardworking.

Nancy is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are 6, 14, and 16 years old.  Her two older children are in high school and her youngest attends a school in the city.  Her emotion is great because she is six months pregnant with her fourth child.  Her husband works at his own business and they own their home.

Nancy takes care of her home and always cares for her children, so currently she is working from her home.  She is knitting wool sweaters, scarves, and hats.  She is doing this work because she is being careful during her pregnancy.  She is also currently taking a cooking course.

She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of wool to continue growing her business.

Her goal is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is still in the poultry business although now she has started grazing cows and crop farming as well. Her business is doing well and she is happy about it.

She has currently borrowed her fifth loan after having repaid the previous ones well. She intends to use this money to purchase a dairy cow and farm inputs for her farm. She anticipates getting profits from which she will expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

Her dreams are to expand her business and give the best education possible to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and some farm inputs.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel does farming in the Kangundo area. She rears dairy cows as well as plants: cash crops such maize, beans and vegetables for sale. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children.

This is her second loan and she plans use the loan amount to buy feed for her dairy cows. She also plans to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. From the profits that she will generate from the sale of milk and the farm produce, she will pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her farming business by buying more dairy cows and planting more cash crops.  Hence,  she will make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed for cows and farm inputs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is still selling cereals but her income has now increased to KES 24,500 after the previous capital boost from the loan advanced to her.

This will be her second loan from KADET and it will help her to add more cereals to her inventory.  The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children. 

Her hopes are to have an expanded business and have an economically stable family.

loans.use: to stock more cereals for her business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 50-year-old dairy farmer. He is married to Lucy, a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been dairy farming as well as supplying milk to his customers for the past three years with a monthly income of 3,000 KES which he uses to support his family. 

Samson is applying for his third loan term from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) after having repaid the previous loans successfully. His dairy farm is doing well. He will use the loan to purchase milk containers for supplying milk. With the anticipated profits from his farm he will educate his children.  

His hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase milk containers for supplying milk.

loans.name: Panin

texts.en:
Panin is 30 years old and married to Kimanyisho. They are blessed with two children aged four years and two years. Panin has been in the farming business for the last three years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Panin has taken his second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) of 40,000 KES with which he plans to purchase sheep, goats and farm inputs.

With the anticipated profit Panin will buy more cattle. His hopes and dream is to raise his business to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and to buy sheep and goats to rear for sale.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Nuevo Amanecer está formado por 8 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que tiene hermosos paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada, se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza, la arquitectura de sus casas es una mezcla de lo tradicional con lo moderno. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas de un buen corazón, muy amables y gentiles, todos los días se encuentran en la lucha para mejorar su estabilidad económica y lo están logrando gracias a su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación, realizan tareas del campo como es la crianza de animales, la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en otras actividades económicas, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Elda, está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras, le gusta este tipo de créditos porque les ayuda a mejorar su estabilidad economía.

La Señora. Elda tiene 39 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes se encuentran de 22, 20, 18, 18, 16 y 13 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente, sus dos hijas gemelas se encuentran trabajando para sus gastos personales, también están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su hijo de 16 años está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su último hijo quien tiene una discapacidad está estudiando en una escuelita para niños especiales, su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Nuestra socia hace 20 años se dedica a la limpieza de diferentes casas, esta actividad la realiza de lunes a sábados, sin un horario fijo, trabajo que le ha permitido mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el pago de los estudios de su hijo con discapacidad, va a comprar uniformes, libros, cuadernos, lápices, etc. 

Su sueño es de ver que un día sus hijos lleguen a tener una profesión.

La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer community bank is made up of eight women and one man who live in the area around the Zhidmad parish in Cuenca.  The area is known for its beautiful landscapes thanks to its rugged geography and it is possible to enjoy nature.  The architecture of the homes is a mix of modern and traditional.  The people, including the group members, are people with good hearts who are friendly and kind.  Every day they are in a fight to improve their financial stability and they are succeeding thanks to their work, effort, and dedication.  They do work such as raising animals, farming, and many work in the city at other economic activities while maintaining the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Elda, who is requesting her second loan together with her friends and companions.  She likes this type of loan because it helps them improve their financial stability.  Elda is 39 years old, married, and has six children who are 13, 16, 18, 18, 20, and 22 years old.  Her two oldest children are married and live independently.  Her twin daughters work for their personal expenses and are also studying at a school in the city.  Her 16 year old son is also studying at a school in the city.  Her youngest son who has a disability is studying at a school for special children.  Her husband works in construction as a builder.  They do not own their home, so they rent.

Elda has worked for 20 years cleaning houses.  She works from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule.  This work has allowed her to improve her household's financial stability.  

She will use the money from this loan to pay for her disabled son to attend school.  She will purchase uniforms, books, notebooks, pencils, and other items.

Her dream is to see her children one day have professions.  

The small photo is of two members who were not able to be present when they took the group photo.

loans.use: to purchase uniforms, books, notebooks, and pencils.

loans.name: Erika María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Mini Bankito se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años, ella vive con su mamá. Este su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos. 

Doña Erika es una mujer muy luchadora que día a día trabaja para darle lo mejor a su hijo y que le falte nada, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y en las tardes también en las tardes vende comida rápida, ella vende hamburguesas, salchipapas, chuzos, sodas y jugos naturales. En las mañanas realiza sus recorridos y por las tardes y noches se dedica a la venta de los alimentos, tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto ella sale adelante sola con su hijo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y víveres para preparar los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
The Mini Bankito communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa settlement, known as the "Sultan of Coffee" because of its extensive coffee crops, which have an incomparable flavor, and for its food and warmth of its people.

Erika lives here.  She is 24 years old and is the single mother of a three year old son.  She lives with her mother and this will be her fifth cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help it has given her through the loans.

Erika is a hardworking woman who works daily to provide the best for her son, so that he needs for nothing.  She sells all types of clothing and also sells fast food in the evenings.  She sells hamburgers, sausage and potatoes, chuzos, sodas, and juices.  In the mornings she makes her rounds and sells food in the evenings and at night.  She's been doing this for more than 10 years and thanks to this she is getting herself and her son ahead.

She will use this loan to buy clothing and ingredients to prepare her food.

Her dream is to provide the best for her young son.

loans.use: to buy clothing and ingredients.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, casada con una hija menor de edad, ella es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de actividades recreativas con su hija, y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera  por falta de recursos económico, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en sus casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, de shampoo, de salsas, de sopas, arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, azúcar y otros. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Maribel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países  pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un  medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maribel is married and has one dependent daughter.  She is from León which is located in the west of the country.  Maribel is known for being very hard working, responsible and having a desire to improve herself.  In her spare time, she enjoys taking part in recreational activities together with her daughter and spending quality time with her.  Unfortunately, she was unable to study for a degree owing to a lack of financial resources but she would have liked to have studied nursing.

Thanks to her strong spirit and her desire to make progress, Maribel has a 'pulperia' business located in her home.  A 'pulperia' is a small store that sells food products in small quantities such as sachets of coffee, shampoo, sauces, soups, rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar, etc.  Maribel works 12 hours a day in her business, selling her products.  Her goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with food products so that, in the not-so-distant future, she can earn better income.  Maribel is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people with limited financial resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store with items such as coffee, shampoo, sauces, soups, rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Penina is now 55 years old and her five children are doing well. She is still operating her mill in Narok area and her income has now increased to Kes 25,000 per month.

Penina has now requested her third loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD, and she intends to use it to purchase more stock of cereals which she will mill and sell as flour. The anticipated profits will used to boost the business. 

Her dream is to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy cereals to mill for resale

loans.name: Tusitala

texts.en: Tusitala is 54 years old and married with one child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as rice, sugar, flour, salt, onions and tinned fish. She has been doing this for 7 years. Tusitala needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, bags of rice, snacks, soft drinks, tinned fish, dripping oil, salt, corn beef and onions. She hopes to use her profits to extend her shop. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, bags of rice, snacks, soft drinks, tinned fish, dripping oil, salt, corn beef and onions.

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebayar, who is 38 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on their own plot of land. He has been running a taxi service to local people since 2009 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, driving them to their destination quickly and taking short routes. His wife has been making and selling Mongolian traditional clothes, called deel, to local people. Using his previous loan, he purchased an electric sewing machine for his wife's business in order to increase her labor efficiency. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase some sheep. During the summer time, he will feed the sheep and later in autumn he will sell them at a higher price in the markets. By beginning this business, he will improve his family's living condition greatly. Mr. Erdenebayar is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 47-year-old lady from Kisumu city. She is married to Asweto who is a businessman and was blessed with three children who are 14, 12 and seven years old.

She hires out plastic seats to people whenever they have a function within their homes and at the market. She has been doing this business for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES. 34,000. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more plastic chairs, hence expanding the business. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to grow her business and to open a catering center so as to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic seats to hire out

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 39-year-old businessman; he is married to Lucy who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling cereals and other farm produce for the past eleven years, with a monthly income of KES 13,000 which he uses to support his family. He also operates a taxi to supplement his income. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. David will use the loan to add to his stock of rice, sorghum, green grams, peas, etc. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will improve his business and educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to supply his farm produce to surrounding towns like Nairobi.

loans.use: to add to his stock of rice, sorghum, green grams (lentils), peas, etc

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebat, who is 52 years old, lives with his wife, daughter and grandchild in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son lives separately from his parents and using his previous loan Mr Erdenebat had purchased a Mongolian traditional portable felt dwelling as a wedding gift to his son and daughter-in-law. His daughter studies at a medical college. During this time period, the final exams of universities begin and the university administration demands its students to pay the remaining tuition fee. He is therefore requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT in order to pay for his daughter's university tuition fee. As a result, his daughter will be able to sit her final exams and advance to the next grade. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's remaining university tuition fee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy paper and other material for her husband's printing press business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 27 years old, a retail shop owner in Voi, Kenya. She is a single lady who supports no one but herself. She has been in this business for the last one and a half years and is doing very well.

This marks her second time borrowing to finance her business, and she will use the loan to purchase cooking fat, sugar, crates of milk, and bales of wheat and maize flour, and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. 

She hopes to grow her retail business to wholesale in future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, sugar, crates of milk, and bales of wheat and maize flour

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 28 years old and works as a hawker of African women's clothing material and also sells coconuts in her Utange village of  Mombasa. She is a married woman and together with her spouse, she supports five children in their family. She has been in this business for the last nine years and has done well.

This marks her second time borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business, after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use this loan to purchase additional African clothing material and the anticipated profit to expand her businesses. She hopes to live a successful life in future.

loans.use: to purchase additional African women's clothing materials for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Fatou est une femme mariée. Elle vit au Sénégal avec sa famille. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et pratique  la vente de légumes et de condiments qui  constitue sa principale source   de revenus. Elle capitalise une expérience de plus de  05 ans dans son activité. Elle est membre à de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  ou elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite à nouveau un  crédit de 200.000 francs CFA prévu pour acheter les produits qu’elle commercialise et qui seront  destinés à la vente. Avec son financement elle pourra  renforcer son fonds de roulement ce qui lui permettra d’acheter d’avantage de légumes afin de satisfaire la demande croissante de sa clientèle. Par conséquent, avec l’augmentation de ses bénéfices, elle compte  diversifier davantage ses produits pour développer son activité. Elle souhaite obtenir une grande boutique où elle pourra exercer son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Fatou is a married woman who lives in Senegal with her family. She works in commerce and sells vegetables and condiments, which constitute her main source of income. She capitalizes on over five years of experience in this business. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where she has already paid back a previous loan. She is again requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA for purchasing the goods that she markets and that will be for sale. Her financing will bolster her working capital enabling her to purchase more vegetables, so as to satisfy her customers' growing demand for vegetables. 

Consequently, with the increase in profits, she plans on diversifying her goods further to develop her business. She would like to have a big store, where she can operate her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 23 years old and a metal fabricator in Voi, Kenya, He is a single man who has been in his field for the last five years and has done great.

This marks his second time borrowing to finance his business, after repaying the first loan successfully. He will use the requested loan to purchase steel for making grills for windows and doors and the anticipated profit to repay his loan. 

He hopes to be the leading steel fabricator in Voi.

loans.use: to purchase steel for making grills for windows and doors

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena is a 48-year-old greengrocer in Voi, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children whose husband gives support with additional income and she has been in this business for the last ten years and is doing well. 

This marks her fifth time borrowing to finance her business, and she will use the loan to purchase green vegetables and fruits for her grocery shop and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to grow her business to selling wholesale in future.

loans.use: to  purchase green vegetables and fruits for her grocery shop

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, 27 years old, runs a retail shop business in Emali town. He is married and has two children. Besides the retail shop, he also has a barber shop in the same area.


This is his third loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include sugar, rice, and cooking oil as well as shaving machines for his barber shop business. 


He will save some of the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to grow his business and open a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and cooking oil, etc. to stock for sale as well as shaving machines for his barber shop

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 26 years old and sells grocery items such as vegetables, carrots, garlic and fruits. She has been in this business for two years and it has been profitable. She is married to Benard who supports the family with the income he gets from his business.

This is her first loan and she plans to buy more stock of vegetables, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, oranges and bananas. She will use the generated income to add more stock of fruits and vegetables.

She hopes to grow her business and open a grocery store in the market place.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 36 years old, married and has two children. He is a dairy farmer in Kangundo town. He supplies milk to various dairy shops and retail shops in the area as well as sells some at the market place. He has been in this business for seven years now. Besides dairy farming, he also plants cash crops such as maize and vegetables to sell.

This is his second loan term and he plans to use the loan amount to buy feeds for his dairy cows. He also plans to buy seedlings for planting. He anticipates to make more income with which he will be able to pay school fees for his children and also buy another dairy cow.

He hopes to improve his farming methods and become one of the best farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed for his cows.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a cash crop and dairy farmer in Kangundo town. He is 31 years old, and married to Jackline who is also a farmer. They have two children. He supplies milk to various dairy shops in the area and also sells maize and vegetables at the market place. He has been in this business for six years and it has been profitable.

This is his first loan and he plans to use the loan amount to buy feeds for his dairy cows. He also plans to buy seedlings for planting. He anticipates to make more income with which he will pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to improve both his farming skills and farming methods and become one of the best farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 26-year-old married man with 2 children. He is applying a loan of 20,000 KES that will be used to purchase second-hand clothes to resell. He has been running this business for the past 2 years in the Mombasa area. He describes the environment as stable and supplies the clothes to local customers. The anticipated profits will be used to restock and further expand his business. This will be his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Agueda Luz

texts.es:
Águeda Luz de 45 años de edad, soltera con un hijo que estudia en secundaria. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Agueda se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal; en sus ratos libre le gustar pasar tiempo de calidad con sus familia y les prepara un plato típico de la región como es “yuca con chingaste” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería general como pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa cosméticos, zapatos, prendas. El dedica  a su actividad unas 10 horas diarias, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Agueda Luz agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Águeda Luz is 45 years old, single and has a son who is currently in secondary school.  She is originally from León, in the west of the country. Águeda is hard-working, responsible and has a great desire to get ahead in life.  In her spare time she likes to spend quality time with her family and to prepare some of the region's typical dishes such as "yuca con chingaste" (a yucca and pork dish).  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, Águeda could not study and was forced to work from a young age in order to help with household costs.

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to prosper, Águeda works selling general merchandise such as trousers, shirts, skirts, clothes, cosmetics and shoes.  She works around ten hours per day, with the business being run out of her home.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock up the business buying merchandise so that, in the near future, she can earn a higher income.  Águeda is grateful to Kiva lenders who are providing people of few resources and poor countries, such as Nicaragua, the chance at having a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her business buying merchandise such as trousers, shirts, skirts, clothes, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Rachael
