En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela que tiene 62 años de edad, hace varios años falleció su esposo y quedo sola ya que no tuvo hijos. Ella vive con una hermana. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido salir adelante además se entretiene en el grupo.

Doña Ángela para salir adelante y más después de la muerte de su esposo en su casa instalo un pequeño comedor en el cual prepara y vende deliciosos platos, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 06h00 hasta la noche ya que prepara desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas.  Su restauran es muy concurrido ya que está en pleno centro de la ciudad y además porque sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank of San Esteban meets every fifteen days in Charapoto. This location is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Ángela, 62, lives here. Her husband died several years ago and she remained alone since she did not have children. She lives with her sister. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because, with the loans, she has been able to get ahead and she also is entertained by the group.  

In order to get ahead, particularly after the death of her husband, Ángela installed a small dining room in her house in which she prepares and sells delicious food dishes. She works from Monday to Saturday from 6:00 a.m. until nighttime, since she makes breakfasts, lunches and snacks. 

Her restaurant is very busy since it is right in the middle of the city and also because her clients prefer the seasonings she puts in her dishes. She will utilize this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other food items for the preparation of her dishes.

Her dreams are to get ahead and have good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other foods

loans.name: Antonia Idalinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Antonia, tiene 65 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes.El marido no trabaja ya que es jubilado.
 
Doña Antonia desde muy joven aprendió corte y confección  y desde hace muchos años puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, aunque lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, en esta temporada también elabora uniformes para escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días cuando tiene mucho trabajo por entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, cierres y muchos otros materiales para confeccionar sus prendas. Lleva 12 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque son muy unidas en el grupo y se ayudan mutuamente. 

Su sueño es tener salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the communal bank "San Esteban" meets every 15 days.  This place is known for its traditional culture, and also for being just minutes away from 2 of the best beaches in the province:  San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Antonia, 65, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage that has produced 4 children who are now adult and independent.  Her husband does not work, as he is retired.

At a very young age, Antonia learned dressmaking, and for many years she has had a small dressmaking workshop in her home.  There she makes all types of garments; although what she enjoys making most of all is children's clothing.  She works based on orders from individuals.  In the current season, she also makes uniforms for the elementary and secondary schools in the town.  She works every day when she has a lot of orders to deliver.

Antonia will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies to make her garments.  She's been with her communal bank for 12 years, and she likes it because the group is very united, and the members help each other.

Antonia's dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and other supplies to make clothing

loans.name: Eddy Amador

texts.es:
Eddy es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Eddy no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eddy trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su trato amable y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Eddy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea ponerle piso de concreto a su casa, la cual es prefabricada y de madera, de esta manera Eddy podrá brindarle mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Eddy is a 32-year-old man who lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and their small child, who he loves and who is his main cause in life. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who, along with his wife, dedicates all his effort to getting his family ahead. 

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need he had to work when he was very young, Eddy was unable to study for a professional degree. In his free time he likes to distract himself by watching television and, on some occasions, cook a delicious Ají de Gallina (a Peruvian chicken and rice dish) to share with his family. 

On his own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Eddy works as a taxi driver offering transportation services in his city. He works every day for approximately 12 hours and believes it is going well for him due to his friendliness and because he knows all the areas where he can find the largest number of passengers.

Eddy is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they offer, he will be able to make improvements to his home. He wishes to put down a concrete floor in his house, which was prefabricated and is made of wood. This way, Eddy will be able to offer his family more security and well-being. Thus he will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having his own transportation business.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El cliente David vive en Quevedo. Casi toda su familia tiene el mismo negocio que es la venta de chochos (maiz) es por eso que empezó desde muy joven. Trabaja con su esposa desde las 7h00 hasta las 16h00.

La dificultad que tiene es la lluvia, su enfermedad y cuando los alumnos están de vacaciones. Es casado su esposa también trabaja en su carrito vendiendo chochas, tiene 2 hijos en escuela fiscal solo esta uno. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar un carrito para la venta de chochos para poder asi tener mas acceso a clientela y asi mejorar sus ingresos. En el futuro quiere arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
David lives in Quevedo.  Almost everyone in his family has the same business: selling corn on the cob.  He started in this line of work when he was very young.  He works with his wife from 7am until 4pm.  

The difficulties he faces include the rain, his illness, and the periods of school vacations.  He is married and his wife also works from his cart selling corn.  David has 2 children, one of whom attends public school

With this loan, he wants to buy a cart to sell corn.  This way, he could have more access to customers and thereby increase his income.  In the future, he wants to fix his house.

loans.use: to buy a delivery cart to sell corn on the cob

loans.name: Alfredo Fidel

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre de 60 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo hace muchos años pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de manejo de maquinaria pesada, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver partido de futbol y en algunas ocasiones cuando visita a su familia cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alfredo trabaja como operador de maquinarias en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, adicionalmente Alfredo se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Alfredo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la reparación de su camioneta, la cual le sirve de mucho para transportar el alimento que necesita para darle a su ganado, de esta manera, Alfredo espera poder ahorrar un poco de dinero para poco a poco aumentar su ganado, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un establo propio.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 60, is single and lives in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts to getting ahead. Thanks to his effort, many years ago he was able to study a technical degree in operating heavy machinery. In his free time he likes to watch soccer games and on some occasions, when he visits his family, he cooks them a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a Peruvian dish with meat, pasta and potatos).

On his own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Alfredo works as a machine operator for a transportation business in his city. He works every day and he can do so for approximately 8 hours. Additionally, Alfredo raises and sells cattle. He feels happy doing his work and believes it is going well for him due to his good performance and the friendly treatment he offers others. 

Alfredo is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help offered by them, he will be able to make repairs to his truck, which has served him greatly in transporting the food that he needs to give to his cattle. In this way, Alfredo hopes to be able to save a little bit of  money in order to increase his livestock bit by bit. Thus he will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having his own barn.

loans.use: to make repairs to his truck

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Исматулло житель города Куляб. Ему 22 года. Он холостой молодой человек, живет с родителями, братьями и сестрой. Его отец работает в городе Душанбе, мать домохозяйка, а братья и сестра учатся в школе. Так как Исматулло старший сын в семье, он после окончания школы начал зарабатывать на жизнь. Уже 5 лет как Исматулло работает в сфере торговли. Он занимается продажей запасных частей автомашин. Его торговая точка расположена в хорошем месте. Сейчас Исматулло хочет увеличить товарооборот. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа товара (запасных частей автомашины). В будущем Исматулло планирует расширить свой торговый бизнес и открыть еще одну точку продажи и нанять продавца.
texts.en: Ismatullo lives in the town of Kulob. He is 22 years old. He is single and lives with his parents, brother and sister. His father works in the city of Dushanbe, his mother is a homemaker, and his brothers and sister are in secondary school. Since Ismatullo is the eldest son in the family, after finishing secondary school he started earning a living. He has been working in retail for five years. He sells automobile spare parts. His sales stand is located in a good spot. At present Ismatullo would like to increase his sales volume. He is requesting a loan to stock up on merchandise (spare auto parts). In the future Ismatullo plans to expand his business by adding a second sales stand and hiring a salesperson.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise (auto spare parts).

loans.name: Jocesito De Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Josecito de Cumbe está formado por 9 mujeres que viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar goza de mucha vegetación con una geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo natural y lo colonial, su gente es muy trabajadora al igual que las socias quienes son mujeres que luchan día a día en sus trabajos para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, son personas que aun mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Lorgia, está realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal Jocesito de Cumbe al cual fue invitad por una vecina y amiga, espera que con los créditos pueda mejorar su actividad económica.

La Señora Lorgia tiene 27 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad quienes pasan en casa, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora. Lorgia pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos que aun están pequeños, como vive en el campo se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y ganado del cual vende la leche, también trabaja en la agricultura la que es para el consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para mejorar sus potreros y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank Josecito de Cumbe is made up of 9 women who live around the Cumbe parish in Cuenca. This place boasts a lot of greenery, with a rugged geography. Its architecture is a mix of the natural and colonial. Its people are hard-working, just like the group members who are women that fight day-to-day by working to offer their children a better future. They are people that still keep their culture and traditions alive.

One of the group members is Lorgia. She is requesting her first loan in the communal bank Jocesito de Cumbe, which she was invited to by a a friend and neighbor. She hopes to be able to improve her work activities.

Lorgia is 27, the single mother of two children, ages 4 and 2, who live at home. She does not have her own home, which is why she lives in a family member's house with her parents, with whom she shares the home expenses. 

Lorgia takes care of her children, who are still small, at home. Since she lives in the countryside, she makes a living raising guinea pigs, hens and cattle, whose milk she sells. She also does farm work, which is for household consumption, but if there are leftovers she sells them.

The money from her loan is to be invested in the purchase of feed for her animals and compost to improve her pastures. Her goal is to have a store in her home.

loans.use: to buy compost and animal feed

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has a motorcycle transport business in Kangundo Town. Besides the motorcycle business as his primary activity, he is also a cash crop farmer: he plants maize, beans and vegetables. He is 29 years old, married and has one child. He has been in the farming business for four years.

This being his third loan term, he plans to buy motorcycle spare parts and service his motorcycle. He also plans to buy farm inputs for use on his farm. These include fertilizer and seeds for planting. He will use the generated income to provide for the needs of his family. He hopes to improve his farming methods, plant more cash crops, make more income, and buy another motorcycle. He will also be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella has a wedding and events planning business in Kangundo Town. She sells decoration materials as well as rents wedding gowns to wedding couples. She has been in this business for four years. She is 29 years of age, married and has two children.

This being her third loan term, she plans to buy wedding decoration materials, such as flowers, ribbons, balloons, cake stands, and also to rent seats. She hopes to generate more income, which she will use to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to establish her business and offer her services to other towns as well.

loans.use: To buy more flowers and wedding materials

loans.name: Derick

texts.en:
Derick sells clothes in Makueni Town including shirts, T-shirts, jumpers and sweaters. He has been in this business for the past six months with a good income. He is 22 years old and single.

This will be his first loan term with KADET Ltd., and he plans to use the loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell, such as T-shirts and trousers. He hopes to open a boutique store and sell more varieties of clothes and shoes as well.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Zarokhon

texts.ru: Зарохон 28-летняя замужняя женщина с двумя детьми. У нее сын и дочь. Зарохон со своей семьей проживает в городе Исфара, на севере страны. Ее муж работает мастером по ремонту домов. Сама Зарохон занимается производством конфет на продажу. Она в этой области уже 6 лет. Зарохон предприимчивая женщина. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность и с этой целью запрашивает кредит для приобретения аппарата по производству конфет и закупа сахара. Зарохон очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Zarokhon is a 28-year old married woman and the mother of two. She has one son and one daughter. Zarokhon lives with her family in the town of Isfara in the North of Tajikistan. Her husband is a house contractor. Zarokhon makes candy for sale. She has been in this business for six years. She is an enterpreising woman. She would like to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy a candy-making machine and stock up on sugar. Zarokhon is really hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy a candy-making machine  and stock up on sugar.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is both a cash crop and livestock farmer within Kangundo town and its environs. The livestock he keeps includes cows, goats and sheep. He has been in this business for the past five years. He is 36 years old and married with three children. 

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. He also plans to buy more goats and sheep for grazing and later sell them at a profit. He will use the generated income to pay school fees for his children. 

He hopes to buy a ranch and rear livestock; hence become one of the best livestock traders in the area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and goats for rearing.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 33 years old and married with three children. He runs a retail shop business in Oloitoktok town, where he has been in business for ten years. His wife also supports the family with the income she gets from her farming business. 

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD, and he plans to buy flour, milk, bread, rice and sugar for resale. He hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of goods for resale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.es:
La Sra. Myrna es originaria de Piedras Negras lugar donde ha vivido toda su vida, es una mamá muy joven de un niño muy lindo, junto a su esposo ha aprendido que para poderle ofrecer todo lo mejor a su hijo, hay que trabajar mucho para que en ningun momento le haga falta nada, ella trabaja en la venta de zapatos, joyería y de ropa ayudandole a su esposo con los gastos economicos del hogar, su esposo trabaja  de albañil desde hace varios años, el cual en estos momentos se encuentra remodelando una pescadería.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA para poder construir una barda por las orillas de su hogar, para tener más protección pués hoy en día se vive mucha inseguridad y no quisiera que nada malo les fuera a pasar, ni mucho menos a su hijo y así él podría salir a jugar en el patio teniendo ella la tranquiladad de que se encuentra seguro.
texts.en:
Myrna is originally from Piedras Negras, the place where she has lived her whole life.  She is a very young mother of a very cute little boy.  Along with her husband she has learned that in order to be able to give all the best to her son, it is necessary to work hard so that he will never lack for anything.  She works selling shoes, jewelry and clothing, helping her husband with the household financial expenses.  Her husband has worked as a bricklayer for several years and he is currently remodeling a fish shop.
 
She is asking for support through Kiva in order to be able to build a security wall around her home to have more protection because nowadays there is a lot of insecurity and she doesn’t want anything bad to happen to them, much less to her son.  This way he could go out to play on the patio with her having the piece of mind that he is safe.

loans.use: to build a security wall.

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua is a 37-year-old father of three children. He is married and runs a tailoring business in Tala, Kangundo town. He makes suits, shirts and dresses. He has been in this business for the past ten years, with good profits. 

This being his third loan term, he plans to use the amount to buy tailoring materials for use. These include sewing materials, thread, zippers and buttons. This will enable him to meet the needs of his customers as well as make more income, which he will use to pay school fees for his children. 

He hopes to grow his business and make more varieties of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine runs an Agrovet business in Kangundo town. She sells farm chemicals, insecticides, seeds for planting and even dairy meal for most of the farmers in the area. She has been in this business for three years. She is 49 years old, married and has four children. 

This being her third loan term with KADET, she plans to buy more stock of fertilizers, pesticides and animal feeds for resale. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business and open another Agrovet business soon. She also hopes to buy a plot and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to add stock of fertilizer, seeds and animal feeds.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man with five children. He describes himself as a focused man. 

He is applying for a loan of KES 26,500, which will be used to purchase a water tank. The tank will collect rainwater during the rainy seasons, so as to improve irrigating his land and having clean water for drinking for his family. 

Paul also operates a furniture workshop in the Voi area. This will be his tenth application for loans with SMEP DTM, with the previous being for KES 150,000, which he paid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a  water tank.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 29 years old and is married with three school-age children. He runs a retail shop in Emali town and has been in the business for six years. He also sells cereals as a secondary business.

This is his third loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock for sale, including sugar, rice and cooking oil, as well as maize and beans. He will use the income generated from his sales to pay school fees for his children. 

He hopes to open a wholesale shop and become one of the best businessmen in the area.

loans.use: to buy more stockto sell in his shop.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 33-year-old married woman, and is blessed with two children, aged nine and five years old.  Edna has been selling second hand clothes for a period of six years, and her monthly income is KES 10,000.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She intends on using the loan to purchase two bales of second hand clothes to re-sell.  The profits that she earns will be used to purchase some farm inputs and also add stock to her current business.

Her dream is to prosper in her business and also to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of second hand clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married with two children. She describes herself as a smart and hardworking businesswoman. She operates a food cafe in Njoro area, and has been doing this for the past twelve years. 

She is applying for a loan of KES 50,000 which she will use to purchase potatoes, flour and sugar. 

She describes the area as busy, and says that inadequate capital is hindering her expanding her business. She also operates a farming business to support her income. This will be his first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Dominico

texts.en:
Dominico is 59 years old, and father of three children, all of whom are currently studying in school. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling goods and services from his general store in Lamu, where he earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000. 

Dominico was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer, and he is applying for his third loan of KES 40,000 to purchase additional stock needed for his business. He will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. 

Dominico hopes to own his own supermarket in the future so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his general store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old, and describes himself as an opportunistic businessman. He operates a cereal business where he purchases maize stock for re-sale. 

He describes the Nakuru area as busy, and most of his customers are local traders. He is requesting a loan of KES 80,000 to expand his business. The major challenge that he faces is inadequate capital for expansion. This will be his first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase maize stock to re-sell.

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Nuevas Amigas es un banco comunal que está formado por 10 socias que viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad y su centro Histórico guarda los secretos de su pasado. Su gente al igual que todas las socias son mujeres carismáticas y alegres que trabajan muy duro día a día para mejorar su estabilidad económica y entregarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gladys, es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas desde hace algún tiempo atrás, tiempo en el que ha establecido una gran amistad con todas las integrantes de este banco comunal. 

Doña Gladys vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo, se encuentra muy alegre ya que está esperando a su segundo bebé. Su esposo labora a diario en el duro trabajo de la construcción, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Gladys desde hace 2 años se dedica a la cría y venta de animales especialmente  de pollos loa cuales ha ido incrementando poco a poco, sus pollos los vende cuando ya tienen un peso y tamaño adecuado, los vende en pie o pelados. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para animales.

Sus metas son sacar adelante a su familia y crecer en su negocio para generar mayores ingresos a su hogar.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
"Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends) is a communal bank that is made up of 10 female members who live in different areas of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the third most important city in the country.  It has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999 and its historical center guards the secrets of its past.  Its people, like all of the charismatic and happy members of the group, work very hard every day to improve their financial stability and give their children a better future.  They still maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is Gladys.  She has been a member of the "Nuevas Amigas" communal bank for some time now, during which she has established a great friendship with all of the members of this communal bank.

Gladys lives in a common-law marriage and has conceived a child.  She is very happy as she is expecting her second baby.  Her husband works daily in the hard job of construction.  The house in which they live is their own.

For two years Gladys has worked raising and selling animals, especially chickens, which has been increasing little by little.  She sells her chickens when they have a suitable weight and size.  She sells them live or plucked.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of chickens and animal feed.  Her goals are to get ahead with her family and grow in her business in order to generate more income for her household. 

The small photograph is of a member that could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 45 years old and married, and supports ten members of her family.  Her children are between the ages of 17 and 2 years old.  She does mixed farming, and has been in this business for a period of seven years, earning an income of KES 25,000.

Having been given a second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, she wishes to use this amount to purchase farm inputs, both for her farming activities as well as for her animals.  The profits she earns will be used to repay the loan and also pay school fees for her children who are in school.

She dreams to live a better live and also prosper in her farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for her farming activities and for her animals.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 year olds, and describes himself as an honest and God fearing person. He has operated a retail shop in the Changamwe area for the past three years. He is applying a loan of KES 20,000 which he will use to purchase sugar, milk, tea leaves, flour as stock. 

Emmanuel describes his area as productive, and one of the challenges that he faces is inadequate capital. This will be his first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, tea leaves and flour for his shop.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 27 years old and is mother of three children, who are currently studying in school. For the last four years, she has earned a living by offering tailoring services in Malindi, where she earns a monthly profit of 9,800 KES.

Juliet was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and she is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000 to purchase additional clothing material needed for her business. She will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, help purchase food for the family and expand the current business. 

Juliet hopes to own her own boutique in future so as to improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing material for her business.

loans.name: Development Group

texts.en:
Ya Marie is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ya Marie was born in Lunsar town, 30 years ago. She is married to a carpenter and the couple have three children. For many years now, Ya Marie has been a businesswoman. Currently, she sells onions.

This is first the loan that Ya Marie and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Ya Marie will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy a large quantity of onions to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of onions to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a Kiva borrower. She has four children aged between 13 and 25 years old. She describes herself as being ambitious. She operates a drinks store where she sells drinks, and has been involved in this business for ten years. 

Janet's business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be economic instability. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more drinks for sell. Her business goal is to be stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children and buy a piece of land. 

This is Janet's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell in her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old, and is married with children aged between 20 and 1 year old. She practices horticulture on her farm, and she has been doing this for a period of thirteen years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

She is now servicing a second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and intends to purchase fertilizers, vegetable seeds and also raised seedbeds.  The profits that she gets from the vegetables sales are used to repay the loan, as well as paying school fees for her children.

Her dream is to improve the living standards for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and raised seedbeds for her farm.

loans.name: Agnes M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of school teachers from the township of Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT to apply for a loan of SLL 15,200,000 in order to solve their most immediate financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.
 
Agnes is the featured leader of this group. Agnes is 42 years old, and is married to a school teacher. The couple have two children who are attending school. Agnes has been a school teacher for 29 years now. 

Agnes has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials, such as iron corrugated sheets, for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials, such as iron corrugated sheets, for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 34-year-old married woman, and supports a family of six members. Her children are aged between 15 and two years old. Jane's main source of income is selling second hand clothing, and she has been in the business for a period of six years, earning an income of KES 10,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD, and intends to use this amount to purchase stock of second hand clothes to re-sell and also purchase some farm inputs. The profits that she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children.  

Her dream is eradicate poverty and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand clothing to re-sell.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: Meri is a young mother from Dimitrov village of the Ararat region, Armenia.  She lives with her husband, in-laws, and little son (shown in the photo).  Meri cultivates land with her family, currently growing apricot and pear trees.  They work hard to gather a good harvest and to sell it in the local market.  The family owns a greenhouse which is too old and needs to be renovated.  Meri has applied for this loan to pay for renovation of the greenhouse as well as for tomato seeds and fertilizer.  The renovation of the greenhouse will give Meri an opportunity to cultivate different types of fruits and vegetables and gather more income.  As agriculture is the only source of income for the family, this loan is very important for Meri to be able to create better living conditions and to sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, fertilizer, and the renovation of the greenhouse.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 30 years old and is married with two children. She has a retail shop in Oloitoktok town. In additon to the retail shop, which she has run for the past ten years, she is also a cash crop farmer. 

This will be Leah's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell in her retail shop. These include sugar, bar soap, detergents, rice and flour. She will use the income generated to buy more goods. 

She hopes to grow her business and open a retail shop business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor has been a farmer for the past 16 years and has developed his farm with his hard work and favorable conditions.  Grigor lives with his mother and twin brothers.  He grows tomato and beans, different types of trees (peach, plum, apple), and raises cattle.  Grigor is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, to purchase seeds (for cultivation), and to cover fuel costs. 

This loan will increase Grigor's income, which is important to help this young farmer meet his family's needs.  He hopes to insure a stable future for his family and to give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and fuel.

loans.name: Daowd

texts.en:
Daowd is a clever, skillful, and calm 31-year-old man.  He is a soldier receiving a low salary where he lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  He is an amazing person with unusually good humane qualities.  He has a huge heart and is a good family man with a loving wife and three children.  He wants a good future for his children because he missed the chance to study and receive a higher education.  

He would like to improve his home by buying new furniture and some home appliances.  For this reason, he took a loan from AMB.  This loan will help him to improve his home and his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and appliances for his house.

loans.name: Al-Nada Group

texts.en: Al-Nada is a group of six poor women from Hodeida, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 290,000 YER.  Jobrana, a 48-year-old married woman, lives with her children in a small house in Hodeida city.  When she felt her husband was unable to cover household expenses, she decided to work and earn money to cover the needs of her children.  She is a door-to-door woman selling cosmetic materials, clothes, and incense.  She earned a good profit from this business, so she decided to purchase more cosmetic materials, clothes, and incense to target new clients.  Therefore, she asked for a loan in the amount of 70,000 YER.  She looks forward to opening a clothing store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic materials, clothes, and incense to sell.

loans.name: Al-Ayhm Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Ayhm, which is comprised of four ladies.  They applied for a loan of 230,000 Yemen rials (YER).  Fatehia lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  She is 41 years old, is married, and has three children.  She has worked in embroidery for many years.  She is so professional in this field that her goods are required in the market.  She started her business with a small amount of capital.  She is applying for a loan of 60,000 YER to buy embroidery threads.  Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family.  Her dream is to expand to other towns to supply embroidered ladies' fabrics.

loans.use: to buy embroidery threads for her business.

loans.name: Sarmen

texts.en:
Sarmen has been a farmer for the past 10 years and has developed his farm with hard work and favorable conditions. Sarmen lives with his wife and three children and works hard to sustain their living.

Sarmen's wife helps her husband with cattle breeding. She milks cows and uses the gathered milk in cheese production. Sarmen sells the gathered milk, meat and cheese to local resellers and earns an income.

Realizing that agriculture is very important for him, Sarmen has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, Sarmen will purchase 14 sheep and will increase his livestock. The loan is important for Sarmen to make his agricultural business profitable and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy 14 sheep

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik has been involved in agriculture for the past 25 years. He breeds cattle and is involved in land cultivation. Andranik is a very enthusiastic person willing to improve his farm and sustain his family of five: Andranik, his wife and their three children. The years of running a farm gave Andranik many loyal customers who prefer to buy agricultural products only from him.

As the farming business is the only source of Andranik's income, he would like to expand it. He has applied for this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation of the land. With the loan's help, Andranik will also renovate the old barn and have an opportunity to increase the livestock. 

Andranik is dreaming of developing his farm so that his children will be able to get involved in agriculture and earn enough income to sustain their families in the future.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and renovation of the barn

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en:
Smbat is from Nor Amasia village in the Armavir region. He works at a local school as a teacher, but unfortunately, it is not possible to survive on a teacher's salary alone and for that reason, Smbat is also involved in agriculture. He keeps pigs and cultivates onions and sunflowers. 

Smbat's family consists of his wife and son who are helping Smbat with the agriculture. Realizing that the farming business is important for the family to gather a stable income during the month, Smbat would like to expand it. He has applied for this loan from SEF International to purchase seeds and fertilizer, which is very important for the successful cultivation of the land. The loan is important for Smbat to have a chance of expanding his agricultural business and gathering a high income.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Salvi

texts.en:
Salvi and her husband (in the photo) are engaged in breeding cattle and in land cultivation. Salvi is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s conditions (her three children are in the photo).

The family’s farm currently includes 25 cows and 10 calves. They also own agricultural land where they cultivate wheat, barley, and potatoes as well as grow plum and pear trees. Together with her husband, Salvi works hard to gather a good harvest and raise the cattle. The gathered agricultural products they sell locally and earn an income, which is the only way of sustaining the family. The income from farming is hardly enough to make ends meet so it is very important for Salvi to expand her farm. She has applied for this loan for purchasing seeds and fertilizer for good cultivation. The loan will help Salvi and her husband to cover fuel costs and take the gathered harvest to the market. So the family works to have a big and successful farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds and to cover fuel costs

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at the local school. He lives with his wife and two children. As a teacher's salary is hardly enough to make ends meet, Samvel is also involved in cattle breeding. Realizing that agriculture helps him to have a stable income, Samvel would like to expand it. He has applied for this loan to purchase land. This will enable him to cultivate different types of fruits and vegetables and gather more income.

Samvel works hard to improve his family's living conditions and ensure a better future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase land for cultivating fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan lives with his mother in the Darbas village of Syuniq region. This region of famous for its severe climate and locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding and some land cultivation.

Stepan is a young farmer. He breeds cattle (cows, pigs, sheep, chickens,) and cultivates barley and potato. He works hard to gather a good harvest and get income, which is vital for sustaining his and his mother's living.

To enlarge his farming business, Stepan has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, he will purchase seeds and will be able to cultivate more fruits and vegetables. He will also cover fuel costs and will take the harvest to the market.

Stepan's only dream is to see his mother without problems and to give her better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and cover fuel costs.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 51-year-old married father of five children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is a bachelor's. He has a grocery store where he sells food and daily home requirements. He became involved in his business three years ago and it is the only source of income for him and his family. Recently, Mohammed's business has faced financial challenges leading to a decrease in his profit. He has stopped providing people's requirements because of the current bad situation that Yemen has been facing. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grocery goods to continue supplying clients' requests. In the future, he is planning to expand his grocery to become a supermarket, and to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to continue supplying clients' requests.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en: Yahya is a 38-year-old married man living in a poor area in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a man who exhibits good moral values, and who is concerned with the well-being of his family. At this time, he is a teacher earning a low salary. He would like to improve his small house. He has requested a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials like wood and cement to finish building his house. He states that he feels happy and grateful to Kiva for the support that he is being provided, because this way he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like woods and cement to complete building his house.

loans.name: Phidelis

texts.en:
Phidelis is 30 years old, married and the mother of three children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Phidelis was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan of 20,000 KES to buy additional dairy equipment, such as milk cans, milking gloves, storage buckets, milk funnels and water cans for the cows to drink. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her farming activities. Phidelis' goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view to increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase milk cans, storage buckets and milk funnels.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 50-year-old married man and has six children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a teacher getting a low salary which is not enough to properly cover his family needs. He works nearly all day and is happy to continue this career. He has owned a small house for many years. He intends to buy construction materials but he doesn't have enough money to cover all the costs. So, he is requesting for a loan of 199,999 YER from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing construction materials in order to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing construction materials in order to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.name: Om-Samir Group

texts.en: This group, called Om-Samir, consists of four members, all of whom are female. They are from Aden, Yemen, and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same area for a long time. They have different businesses. They have requested a loan of 220,000 YER. Aziza is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children, and she strives to support and give them a quality education. She has been selling grocery products and getting low daily income. She started her own business, which is her main source of income. Her business is not running well due to the lack of money to stock her business. This is why she's requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to purchase grocery products for her business. She hopes she can improve her family's financial stability with this investment and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for her business.

loans.name: Zahrt Al-Dar Group

texts.en: This group is called Zahrt Al-Dar Group. It consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Entsar, 34, is the mother of two children. She lives with her family in Aden. She assists her husband to provide for her family. She has sold perfume, incense, clothes and makeup, trying to help her husband with the family's daily expenses. She would like to expand her business. So, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and makeup for her business. She expects a boost in her income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and makeup for her business.

loans.name: Magerena

texts.en:
Magerena is a married lady, age 43, blessed with four children between the ages of 18 and 6 years old. She keeps livestock on her farm, which has been in operation for over 10 years. She is earning an income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the sale of milk.

Magerena is now servicing her sixth loan of 20,000 KES from KADET Ltd. and intends to pay school fees for her school-going children. The anticipated income she earns from the farm will be used to pay back the loan and improve the living standards of her family. Her dream is to improve her dairy farm.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Ayon Al-Maha Group

texts.en: This group is called Ayon Al-Maha has four members, all of whom work in a small business. They live together in Aden, Yemen. The women feel very excited by the mutual support among them, which is constant and above all inspires them with the will to continue striving for their families. Their work as a team and utilizing all their available resources makes their efforts their greatest strength. Maha is 41 years old, a married woman who has three children. She is a street vendor, and through her selfless work, she is raising her family. She has been selling perfumes and ladies' clothes. She defines herself as a very hard-working person who does not fear challenges and dares to do anything to help her family. She is applying for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy items including perfumes and ladies' clothes to resell and thus continue improving her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy items including perfumes and ladies clothes to resell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 37 years old and the mother of three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling goods and services from her general store in Mpeketoni, Lamu, earning a monthly profit of 16,500 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Ann was introduced to KADET by a credit officer, and she is applying for her fourth loan of 30,000 KES to purchase additional stock, e.g., wheat and maize flour, washing detergents and sugar for sale in her business. She will use the profit from the business to pay school fees for her children, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. Ann hopes to own a supermarket in the future so as to improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, e.g., wheat and maize flour, washing detergents and sugar

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en: Mr. Batnasan, 35, lives with his wife, three children and father in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been running a music training center for nine years. Generally his wife teaches music to students and he has duties managing this training center. His wife teaches how to play piano, harp and guitars to children. Due to his excellent management and his wife's teaching skills, the number of students enrolling in this training is increasing each day. So he decided to purchase additional musical instruments. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a piano, guitars and harps. By doing so, he will be able to expand his business as well as to generate more income for his family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who worked in Korea on employment contract before this business.

loans.use: to purchase a piano, guitars and harps.

loans.name: Millycent

texts.en:
Millycent is 34 years old, married and a mother of four children. She offers tailoring services in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last eight years. She earns a monthly profit of 13,150 KES.

Millycent was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her third loan of 20,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to add some clothing material for her business. She will save the anticipated profit and help pay the school fees of her children.

In the future, Millycent hopes to grow her tailoring services as she intends to open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing material needed for her business.

loans.name: Maricus

texts.en:
Maricus is a 55-year-old man from Homabay, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Mrs. Atieno, who is a farmer too, and he supports three people and was blessed with five children who are 21, 18, 15, 13 and 8 years old sequentially.

He sells animals, which include cattle and goats. It is a business he has been doing for the last 13 years. He is able to generate a monthly income of Kes 24,000 which caters to his family's needs.

He is taking his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more cattle for resale, and he will use the anticipated profit to educate his children.

His dream is to see his family living well.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and goats.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 55 years old and runs a house rental business in Nairobi’s Thika road area. He has been in this business for 10 years now. He is married and has four children. 

This is his fourth loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan to buy building materials to repair his rental houses. These include paint, ceiling boards, water taps and sinks. 

This will enable him to keep the houses in good condition and attract more tenants. He will use the generated income to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to buy another plot and build more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his rental houses.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 34 years old, married and has two children. She has a retail shop in Nairobi's Eastlands area. She sells polythene bags, matchboxes, and candles among other items. She has been in this business for eight years.

This is her second loan and she plans to buy more stock of polythene bags, matchboxes, toothpaste, shoe polish and tissue papers to sell. She will use the generated income to buy more stock.

She hopes to grow her business and open another retail shop as well as make more income and be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of polythene bags, matchboxes, toothpaste, shoe polish and tissue papers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary does a knitting business in Kangundo town. She knits mostly sweaters for schoolchildren as well as caps and shawls for newborn babies. She is 38 years old, married and has four children.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan to buy knitting threads for use in her business. This will enable her to knit many sweaters as well as meet her customers' demands. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to open a knitting shop in Nairobi town.

loans.use: To buy thread for knitting.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 26 years old and single. He sells phone accessories in Nairobi town and he has been been in this business for five years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan amount to buy mobile phone accessories such as phone batteries, chargers, earphones and phone covers to sell. This will enable him to generate more income.

In the future, Festus hopes to grow his business and sell mobile phones and supply phone accessories to various phone traders in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stock of phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac seeking a top-up loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase an additional 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Isaac started selling lights in August, 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer in Kangundo town. He plants maize, beans, bananas and vegetables to sell. He is 58 years old and has five children. He has been in the farming business for three years and it has been profitable.

This being his second loan from KADET LTD, he plans to buy fertilizer for his crops and seedlings for planting. He will use the anticipated profits from the harvest to buy more land for farming.

He hopes to grow his farming business and become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Assane est un homme agé de 49ans marié et père d'un seul enfant agé de 7ans; il évolue dans le secteur de l’élevage depuis près de 10 ans. Il fait plus précisément de l'élevage des moutons. 
Il participe aux dépenses de la maison. Il a toujours travaillé avec ses propres moyens c’est seulement pour cette fois si qu’il désire emprunter une somme de 100000F CFA à l’IMCEC pour l’achat d'aliments de bétail. Le crédit aura un impact positif sur son travail puisqu’il lui permettra de diversifier les produits et services, d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille et de mettre un peu d’argent de coté. Dans l’avenir il désire ouvrir une ferme agricole.
texts.en:
Assane is a 49-year-old man who is married and the father of one 7-year-old child. He has been involved in raising livestock for almost ten years. More specifically, he raises sheep.

Assane regularly contributes to his family's expenses. He has always managed to work using his own financial means, and this is the first time that he is requesting a loan from the UIMCEC. He is taking a loan of 100,000 francs to buy feed for his livestock.

This loan will have a positive impact on his activity, since it will allow him to diversify his products and services, to improve his family's food conditions, and to save a little money. In the future, he would like to open an agricultural farm.

loans.use: to buy feed for the sheep he raises and later sells

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
le banc villageois qui abrite ce groupe de 6 personnes a été créé le 27 mai 1997. Ces 6 femmes qui habitent le même village et font toutes le commerce. Fatou la représentante  est âgée de 47 ans, elle est marié et mère de 7 enfants dont 5 garçons de 27,24,21,15,9 ans et 2 filles de 18 et 12 ans.elle a levé sa main sur la photo.son activité principal est le commerce,elle achète en ville pour vendre chez elle au village.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des boubous prêt a porter pour enfant des chaussures et des porte monnaies à 250.000 francs cfa, du poisson fumé et séché et des fruits de mer à 220.000 francs cfa. Elle mène cet activité depuis 15 ans et elle s'en sort très bien. 
Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son marie dans les dépenses de la maison a savoir la scolarité des enfants la nourriture et la santé. elle respect aussi ses épargnes dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois to which this group of six persons belongs, was created on May 27, 1997.  These six women live in the same neighborhood and are all involved in retail. 

Fatou, the group's representative, is 47 years old.  She is married and the mother of seven children: five boys (aged 27, 24, 21, 15 and 9) and two girls, aged 18 and 12.  Fatou is raising her hand in the photo.  Her main activity is retail: she buys her goods in the city and resells them at home, in her village.

She plans to use her loan to buy some ready-to-wear "boubous" for children, some shoes, wallets (for 250,000 francs), smoked and dried fish, as well as seafood (for 220,000 francs).  She has been involved in this type of activity for 15 years and she manages very well.

She uses her profits to help her husband cover some of the household's expenses: she pays for food, and takes care of the children's school fees and health-related expenses.

loans.use: to buy some ready-to-wear "boubous" for children, some shoes, wallets, smoked fish, dried fish as well as seafood.

loans.name: G.s Caserio El Cedrito Group

texts.es:
La señora Sayda  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  sus  4 hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  de gallinas desde hace más de 12 años. 
Doña Sayda el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de  gallinas. Con el crédito  espera  que sus ventas aumenten gracias a que contara con más capital fresco para invertir en su negocio.
Doña Sayda al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan  cubrir sus necesidades y así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como uno de los más grandes y  reconocido de la zona.
Doña Sayda desea seguir apoyando a  su familia  e hijos para que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad.
Don Víctor su negocio es la  pulpería  desde hace 6 años 
Don Marlene su negocio es la mini  pulpería  desde hace 10 años.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Abril  del 2013
texts.en:
Sayda is very enterprising.  She lives with her four children in a community in Honduras and, for twelve years, she has had a business selling hens.

Sayda needs this loan to buy hens.  She hopes that, with the loan, her sales will increase as she will have more capital to invest in her business.

Like the other members of her group, Sayda hopes to cover necessary costs and to improve her financial situation, and hopes that this will happen with this loan.  In years to come Sayda dreams of her business becoming one of the best known and biggest in the area.

Sayda wants to continue supporting her family and children so that they become good citizens.

Victor's business is a grocery store, which he has had for six years.

Marlene also has a small grocery store; she has had it for ten years now.

Choluteca, Honduras.  April 2013

loans.use: to buy hens for her business.

loans.name: Estefani

texts.es:
Estefani es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camana con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Estefani pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Secretariado, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Estefani trabaja como Secretaria en un instituto de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Estefani se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso de su hogar, de esta manera Estefani podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Estefani is 20 years old, single and living in the city of Camana with her parents and siblings. She is friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic, with a great desire to prosper in life.  Thanks to her own efforts and support from her parents, Estefani was able to study at secretarial school.  In her spare time she likes to watch films and, on occasion, she prepares a delicious "arroz con pollo" (a traditional, Peruvian dish made with rice and chicken) to share with her family.

With her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Estefani works as a secretary in a local secondary school.  She works every day for around ten hours per day.  She believes that the work is going well because she works well and because of the friendly treatment that she gives to others.

Estefani is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to make improvements to her home.  She wants to put up plaster, do some painting and lay down a floor as this will be safer and better for her family.  Estefani can then continue to work and put in the effort to achieve her great dream of becoming a strong professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias de la vida, se separó de su esposa, pero él dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, Alfredo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Arte que deseaba, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar una riquísima Sopa de Leche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alfredo trabaja como agente de seguridad, brindando servicios de vigilancia en un centro comercial de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Alfredo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá de materiales de construcción, como ladrillo, cemento, arena y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder construir una habitación en su hogar, de esta manera Alfredo y su familia contarán con un ambiente seguro y adecuada, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un mejor trabajo para brindarle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 45 years old, single and living in the city of Pisco with his young son, whom he loves and who is his main reason for living. He is very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic.  Unfortunately, as a result of various circumstances,Alfredo is separated from his wife.  However, he puts all his efforts into helping his son prosper.  Alfredo was not able to study art as he had wanted because he had to work from a very young age in order to help his parents.  In his spare time Alfredo likes to cook a delicious "sopa de leche" (rice pudding) to share with his family.

With his own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Alfredo works as a security guard in a local shopping centre.  He works every day for around twelve hours per day.  He believes that the work is going well because he works well and because of the friendly treatment that he gives to others.

Alfredo is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, he will be able to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, sand and more.  These will help him greatly to build a new room in his home.  With this room, Alfredo and his family will have extra space that is secure and useful.  Alfredo can then continue to work and put in the effort to achieve his great dream of giving his son a good education.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has two children aged nine and 11 years. She describes herself to be self-driven and humble. She operates a drinks store. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more drinks to sell in her store. Her business goal is to have more businesses within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell at her store.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is a married man. He has five children ranging in age from five to 16 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a daycare service where he cares for children. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy school equipment. His business goal is to open a school within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy school equipment for his daycare service.

loans.name: G.s Santa Martha 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora  María es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con sus y 2 hijos y 4 nietos en una comunidad de Choluteca en la zona sur de Honduras. 
Doña María su negocio es la compra y venta de gallinas. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de gallinas espera que con esta inversión que realice sus   ventas aumenten gracias a que contara con más mercancía (gallinas) que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan y así cubrir sus necesidades.
Doña María al igual que sus compañeras de grupo  desean que su calidad de vida mejore un poco y se vea reflejado con esta inversión.
Doña María en unos años sueña que su negocio sea más grande y  poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.
Doña Isabel su negocio es la  compra y venta de gallinas desde hace 18 años.
Doña Milares  su negocio es la venta de dulces y refrescos desde hace 10 años en los diferente caseríos cercanos a su comunidad.
Doña Yesica  su negocio es  una mini pulpería en  su comunidad desde hace 4 años.
Doña su negocio es  venta  de tortillas  refrescos y  pollo. Desde hace 3 años en su casa de habitación.



Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del 2013
texts.en:
María is an honest, responsible, and hardworking person. She lives with her Terri children and four grandchildren in a community in Choluteca, in the south of Honduras. 

María's business is buying and selling chickens. She needs the loan to buy chickens. She hopes that with this investment her sales will increase, since she'll have more merchandise (chickens) to offer to the clients who come, so that she'll be able to meet her needs. 

María, like the other group members, hopes her quality of life will improve a bit with this investment.

María dreams that within a few years her business will be bigger so that she can continue supporting her children so that can become professionals with better opportunities. 

Isabel has been buying and selling chickens for 18 years.

Milares has been selling sweets and soft drinks for 10 years in the various small towns near her community.

Yessica has had a small grocery store in her community for four years.

Carmen's business has been to sell tortillas, soft drinks, and chicken for the past three years from her house. 

Choluteca, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: to buy chickens got her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be kind, patient, and trustworthy. She operates a day care facility where she cares for children. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are regular customers mostly parents with young children. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a small house and parents coming late to collect their children. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to increase the size of her day care facility and also start a school. Her business goal is to have more classes within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to increase the size of her day care facility and also start a school.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO-YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 
El socio es el Sr. Vicente; el tiene 54 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado,el socio vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados,el socio los hace engordar y crecer y los vende,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien . El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para el ganado y comprar 1 ganado. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vicente belongs to the "San Isidro-Yanahuara" communal bank, which is in the Urubamba district (part of the Urubamba province in the Cusco department).

Vicente is 54 years old, married and has three children.  He has a business buying and selling cattle at the local fairs and markets.  Vicente fattens up and raises the animals and then sells them.  He has had the business for six years and it is going very well.  He is applying for a loan in order to buy a cow and cattle feed.

Vicente is happy with this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to buy a cow and cattle feed.

loans.name: Carolin

texts.en: Carolin is a single woman. She has two children with the ages of three and 17 years. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a toilet service where customers use the toilet at a cost. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a slum setting and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more toilets. Her business goal is to have multiple toilets and water sources within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to install more toilets for her public toilet service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a computer service. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy environment. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase software to upgrade computers. His business goal is to open a larger store within five years. This will be his first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase software to upgrade computers.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a mason in Kangundo town where he constructs houses. He is 67 years old, married and has five children. He has also employed some more masons and this has enabled him to meet his clients' demands on time.

This is his second loan term and he plans to use the loan amount to buy construction materials for use. These include mortar board stands, concrete trowels and wheelbarrows. This will enable him to make the work more efficient. He will use the generated income to open a retail shop for his son.

Simon hopes to expand his masonry business to other towns in the region.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Bolortsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Bolortsetseg, 33-years-old, lives with her husband and three-year-old son in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her husband has been working at a supply department of a carpet factory. Her son goes to kindergarten. She herself has been working as a seller for someone's stall until 2008. In 2008, she began renting a stall at a trade center and selling food stuffs to local people. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase food stuffs in large quantity. As a result, she can continue to run her business without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase food stuffs in large quantity.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 65 years old, married and has four children. She sells fish in Makueni town and has been in this business for the past three years.

This is her third loan term with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the amount to buy more stocks of fish to sell. She anticipates making more income, which she will use to provide for the needs of her family.

She hopes to grow her business by supplying fish to hotels and restaurants in the area; hence, making more income and being able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has a computer services business in Oloitoktok town. These services include printing, photocopying, typing and editing, scanning, lamination as well as selling printing paper. She is 32 years old, married and has one child. She has been in this business for five years.

This will be her second loan and she plans to buy stationary items for use in her business. These include printing and lamination papers, envelopes, files and notebooks. She will also supply some of these items to various offices in the area.

She hopes to grow her business and purchase more computers and printers, and open a cyber cafe.

loans.use: To buy stationary for her computer services business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 61 years old, married and has five children. He has a retail shop in Kangundo town and has been in business for the past 12 years. 

This is his second loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include sugar, rice, milk, flour, shoe polish, and exercise books as well as detergents. The anticipated profits from the business will enable him to provide for the needs of his family.
