He hopes to open another retail shop in the area, and make more income to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To add more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 33 years old, married and has two children. She has a motorcycle and has employed someone to do a transportation business. She has been in the business for six years and it has been profitable.

This being her third loan, she plans to use the loan amount to buy another motorcycle. This will enable her to generate more income, which she will use to the pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to buy more motorcycles and expand her transportation business; hence, making more income and providing for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Tserenbat

texts.en: Tserenbat is a 23-year-old guy who lives with his family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He is a student of Darkhan University; besides his study, he works as an auto-repair man. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to pay his last tuition fee for this year.

loans.use: to pay his last tuition fee.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce sells cosmetics and beauty products in the town of Oloitoktok. She is 31 years old, single, and has one child. She has been in this business for five years.

This will be her first loan term from KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy braids, hairbands, hair oil, and hair treatments as well as hair clips and lotion. She will use the generated profits to buy more stock of beauty products.

She hopes to grow her business and buy a blow dry machine and start a salon business.

loans.use: to buy braids, hairbands, hair oil, and hair treatments as well as hair clips and lotion for her cosmetic sales business.

loans.name: Hussna

texts.en:
Hussna is 34 years old, married and has three children. She sells timber to construction sites and carpenters in the town of Kangundo. She has been in this business for four years and it has been profitable.

This will be her first loan term from KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of timber to sell. She anticipates using the generated profits to open a retail shop.

She hopes to be successful in business, make more income, and be able to provide good education for her children.

loans.use: To add more stock of timber to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 61 years old and has a retail shop. She has been in the business for the past 11 years and it has been profitable. She is widowed and has two children.

This is her fourth loan and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice, and cooking fat. She will use the generated profits to buy a plot and build rental houses.

She hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 30 years old, married and has one child. He has a pharmacy on Thika Road area in Nairobi. He has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his third loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of medicines to sell in his business. He will use the generated income to provide for the needs of his family.

He hopes to grow his business and open another pharmacy in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stock of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 51 years old, married and has three children. He does taxi business on Thika Road in Nairobi. He has been in the business for 12 years.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the amount to buy new wheels and a battery for his car. This will keep his taxi in good condition and also enable him to generate more income, which he will use to provide for the needs of his family. 

He hopes to buy another car for taxi business.

loans.use: To buy new wheels and a battery for his transportation business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, 43-years-old, is a carpenter in Kangundo. He is married and has five children. He make tables, chairs, wall units, shelves, and beds. 

This being his third loan, he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of timber and nails for use in his business. This will enable him to meet the demands of his customers and thereby make more profits, which he will use to pay the school fees for his children and also provide for the needs of his family.

He hopes to open another carpentry business and become successful.

loans.use: To buy timber for and nails for use.

loans.name: Darkhantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Darkhantuya, 47-years-old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been running a children's clothes sales business since 2011 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in selling clothes. As each passing day, her sales volume was increasing, so she rented an additional stall at another trade center. Now she sells not only children's clothes, but also various types of female and male clothes. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase various types of clothes from her suppliers. As a result, she can continue to run her business without worrying about inventory shortages. With her business profit, she wants to invest in her children's education such as tuition fees, and the cost of dorms and books. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for her family.

loans.use: to purchase various types of clothes.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Jovita; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos entre otros productos , la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y aceite

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jovita belongs to the 'San Isidro de Yanahuara' community bank which is located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Jovita is 51 years old, married, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.  She would like to expand her grocery store business and is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, sugar and oil.

Jovita is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar and oil wholesale, and also to buy animals

loans.name: Ma Sofia

texts.es: La Sra. Ma Sofia de  52 años de edad  tiene una pequeña tienda de Abarrotes nos comenta que  el   negocio ha marchado muy  bien,  ella tiene planes de incrementar la variedad de productos para poder  brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes,  satisfacer sus requerimientos y poder incrementar el número de ellos,  por lo cual solicita un crédito  para  comprar  mas mecancia como mandado y productos de limpieza que es lo que le esta haceindo falta , ella piensa liquidar su crédito en un año con las ganacias de su negocio..
texts.en: 52-year-old Maria Sofia has a small convenience store.  She says that the business has done very well and she has plans to increase the variety of products she sells so that she can provide her customers with a better service, satisfy their needs and increase their number.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as groceries and cleaning products which is what she is lacking.  She plans to pay back her loan in one year with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries and cleaning products)

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA, el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Angélica tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente feliz con su negocio ya que mediante este su negocio la socia puede sacar adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz y azúcar para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Angélica belongs to the 'San Isidro de Yanahuara' community bank which is located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Angélica is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her convenience store business.  She has been working in her business for years and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  She feels happy with her business because it allows her to provide for her family.

Angélica requested this loan to buy rice and sugar for her business.  She feels grateful for the loan she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has two children aged three and ten. She describes herself as patient. She operates a farming business where she sells milk, eggs, chicken, kale and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a stock of animal feeds and vegetables. Her business goal is to become a whole-seller within five years. She hopes in the future to purchase land and construct rental houses. This is her third successive loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a stock of animal feeds and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from seven to 21. She describes herself as honest. She operates a cosmetics shop where she sells body oil, toothpaste and other cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more toothpaste, earrings and other cosmetics. Her business goal is to have multiple outlets within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more toothpaste, earrings and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Mt Usambara Group

texts.en:
Salome, who is in her early 30s, is married with one daughter who goes to school. She has been selling fried fish for four years now. She wakes up early at 4.00 am in order to collect fresh fish and comes back to fry the fish at around 10.00 am. She sells her fish up to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salome's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use it to increase her stock of fish. Her dream is to one day be able to own a Hotel.

Salome will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Usambara" with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of fish.

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Maonyesho, who is in his late 30s, is single with two children who are still going to school. He has been selling cold drinks for three years now. He works from 6.00 am to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Maonyesho's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock the out-of-stock items and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more soft drinks, like sodas, juice and water. His dream is to one day be able to sell wholesale.

Maonyesho will share this loan with his loan group "Kondoa" which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, like sodas, juice and water.

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Merina, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children who go to school. She has been a food-vendor for ten years now. She works from 6.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Merina's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing her stock of food. She started with just ten kilos of wheat flour, five kilos of beans, a bottle of cooking oil, a small packet of charcoal and one kilo of meat. But now she buys in bulk; for example, 50 kilos of wheat flour, 35 kilos of beans, two sacks of charcoal, a bucket of cooking oil, 20 kilos of meat, and all this is just in a week. 

She used to only sell vitumbuwa (a kind of fried dough) and mandanzi (a type of doughnut), with beans early in the morning. But now after breakfast she sells food for lunch and dinner as well. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to buy a TV set, bought a land, bought her sofa set, paid school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the missing items in her food store. She dreams of owing a building.

Merina will share this loan with her loan group "MOMELA" which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in her food store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has a child who is 30 months old. He describes himself as honest. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more meat to sell. His business goal is to own a restaurant within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
The previous loan that was given to Willy has ended and he saw growth in his business. He is now seeking a loan of 26,250 Kenya shillings to add stock to his boutique. 

A major setback is the competition from other businesses. He plans to open a wholesale shop and open more branches of his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has two children aged 15 and 22. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a beauty salon where he does hair treatment and hair dressing. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add hair braids, cosmetics and other items for use in salon. His business goal is to have more salons within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hair braids, cosmetics and other items for use in his salon.

loans.name: Nikel Group

texts.en:
HAWA, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  She has been selling new clothes door to door for both men and women. She has been in this business for two years now.  She works from 11:00am to 3:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hawa's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stock of clothes. She also sold charcoal for some time.  She has paid back her loans successfully.  She used the profit to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more new clothes to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group, "Nikel", with 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to resell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 7 years. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a meat supply service where he supplies meat to butchers. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the perishability of meat. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more meat to sell. His 5 year business goal is to have his own butcher shop and motorbikes for delivering the meat. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 1 child, aged 4. He describes himself to be understanding. He operates a meat supply service where he supplies meat to butcheries. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the perishability of meat. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more meat for resale. His business goal is to own multiple businesses within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay his house rent.

loans.use: Buy more meat for resale.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man. He has a child who is 2 years old. He describes himself to be energetic. He operates a transport service where he transports passengers around Nakuru town. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to expand his business. His business goal is to to own a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. This is his 1st loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Manchesta Group

texts.en:
Javan, who is in his late 20s, is single.  He has been running a photography business since 2009.  He works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy albums and photo frames to resell.  He has managed to pay back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay his shop and house rent along with household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy an up-to-date digital camera.

Javan will share this loan with his loan group "MANCHESTA" which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy an up-to-date digital camera.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

 La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia vende chalinas, guantes y maletines, ella vende en el distrito de Yanahuara en un hotel llamado Casa Andina, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía y comprar materiales para hacer la artesanía.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the San Isidro de Yanahuara community bank, which is located in the Urubamba district in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

Gregoria is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She balances her daily activities with a business selling handicrafts.  She sells scarves, gloves, and bags in the Yanahuara district at the Casa Andina hotel.  She works from 5:00am until 10:00pm.  

She would like to expand her business selling handicrafts.  She is requesting this loan to purchase handicrafts and materials to make them.  

Gregoria is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts and materials to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Gjelina

texts.en:
Gjelina is 55 and has been VisionFund Albania’s client for a very long time, and in good standing according to the loan officer.  She has four children who are married and they reside in the northern part of the country along with Gjelina.

About two years ago, she started her own activity in livestock and since then she said her family’s income has slightly increased. She has been selling milk and homemade cheese to the local market in a little nearby town of approximately 10,000 inhabitants. 

To improve her family’s living conditions she needs to add more animals, and this is why she is applying for a loan this time - to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Luce

texts.en:
Luce is requesting a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek to repair her existing animal stable. “I wanted to take advantage of the summer months now and repair the stable before the cold fall and winter kicks in again," she said. Luce is a 55-year-old villager and a mother of two grownups whose activity for the past year has been with livestock.
 
“I had no other choice but to start selling dairy to locals, and for this I needed to add more animals and I did so. Before, I had cows and I used their milk and other dairy products to feed my family. To start selling milk and generating an income, though, instead of meeting only my family’s needs with dairy, I added more cows. It's the same work, but I find myself more overloaded now because I have to take the milk to the local market everyday and wait until it’s sold,” Luce said.

loans.use: to repair the stable before the cold fall and winter kicks in.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Benjamin is a 38-year-old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a photography business where he covers events by taking photographs. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in the Nakuru area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to purchase a photocopying machine. This is his 3rd successive loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopying machine.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Milagros; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio a la vez la socia trabaja como guía de turismo, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas para su negocio. 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “San Isidro de Yanahuara” communal bank. The bank is located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province and Cusco department, Peru.

The member's name is Milagros. She is 37 years old and she and her partner have a son. The member splits time between her daily activities and her grocery store. She sells a variety of products, such as rice, sugar, milk, and candy, among other things. Milagros has been running her business for a while and it is going well thanks to her daily determination. She also works at a tourist guide so that she and her family will be able to get ahead.

Milagros is seeking this loan in order to buy sodas for her business. 

She is pleased with the loan and is dedicated to making all her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy sodas for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 66 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz),la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cuyes y gallinas, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes para su negocio.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cuzco. 

Her name is Victoria. She is 66 years old and in a common law marriage. She has 4 children. She alternates her home activities with her business selling chicha (a corn based drink). She has had the business for years thanks to the hard work she puts into it. She also raises and sells animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. This is the way she gets her family ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 40-year-old single woman. She has 2 children, ages 4 years and 10 years. She describes herself to be persistent. She operates a farming business where she sells cabbages in the Nakuru area. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy cabbages for resale. This is her 3rd application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cabbages for resale.

loans.name: Kariakoo Group

texts.en:
Ashura is in her early 30s and married with two children who go to school. For the past four years, she has been running a business selling second-hand clothes. Ashura is doing fine with her family and business. She works daily from six in the morning through six at night and is able to make a good monthly profit. Ashura will share her loan with her loan group, "Kariarkoo," which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

Ashura is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothing to sell. This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Ashura has successfully repaid her previous loans and was able to replenish her clothing stocks and earn more revenue. She used the profit from her previous loans to provide food for her family as well as cover household expenses and pay school fees. In the future, Ashura dreams of building a nice house for her family.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 68 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus animales como gallinas, cuyes y chanchos para luego y luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes para su negocio.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the San Isidro de Yanahuara community bank, which is located in the Urubamba district in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

Josefina is 68 years old, widowed, and has seven children.  She balances her daily activities with her business raising animals.  She has done this work for years and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  She raises animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs and later sells them to customers who order them.  This business is the way Josefina improved her family's situation.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase guinea pigs for her business.

Josefina is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Karin;; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cafetería, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son galletas, hamburguesas entre otros, la socia tiene su cafetería en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas para su cafetería.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cuzco.
 
Her name is Karin. She alternates her home activities with her business, which is a cafe. She has had her business for years, thanks to the hard work she put into it every day. What she sells are cookies, hamburgers and more. Her cafe is in one of the area high schools and she wants to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy sodas for her cafe. She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sodas for her cafe.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She can usually be found selling her ‘Kenkey’ in Asamaso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Esi is married and has no children. Her husband is currently unemployed.

As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the family’s general expenses. Esi wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, hence helping to increase her current inventory levels. Consequently, this loan will help her prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her to expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married to a farmer. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. Esi currently sells cooking ingredients in Asamaso (near Cape Coast). With many years of experience in this trade, Esi sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. However, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more cooking ingredients, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Esi wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more cooking ingredients, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, she sells fish in Asamaso (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 5 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have 4 children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. For the past four years, Ekua has prepared and sold "kenkey," a traditional Ghanaian staple made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves, to earn a living. She sells her kenkey in Asamaso, near Cape Coast. Ekua is the sole breadwinner in her family.

Ekua is requesting a loan to purchase increased amounts of maize to prepare kenkey. Her loan will help to improve her sales. Ekua plans to use the profit from her loan to expand her business and diversify the types of products that she sells to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase maize to prepare and sell kenkey

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Even though Abena grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Abena is an entrepreneur. She sells plastic bowls in Asamaso (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 1 year ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 3 children. 

Abena has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more plastic bowls to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls to sell.

loans.name: Irum's Group

texts.en:
Irum is 29 years old and is married with two children. She lives in  Rawalpindi, Pakistan, and is a young and energetic woman. Irum's husband runs a small shop located at the corner of his street. 

Irum is a member of a two-person loan group and is pictured here raising her hand. She is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cold drinks for her husband to sell. As the summer season has arrived, her husband would like to have cold drinks available at his shop to meet customer demand. Irum's loan will increase her husband's sales and income. Irum is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El señor René es una persona muy  emprendedora, responsable, honesta y trabajadora,  vive  con   sus  3 hijos y su esposa en una comunidad de Choluteca en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería. 
Don René el préstamo lo necesita para comprar de refrescos,  maíz, pan, azúcar,  café, agua, huevos, leches, café, frijoles, manteca, pan, etc.  Espera que esta inversión le ayude un poco a mejorar su calidad de vida y la su familia.
Don René en el futuro espera que  su negocio siga  creciendo  y que con la inversión que realice se pueda posicionar como uno de las pulperías mas reconocidas de la zona.   
Don René  sueña con ver a sus hijos y nietos convertiros  en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad




Choluteca, Honduras –  Abril  del  2013
texts.en:
René is a very enterprising, responsible, honest and hardworking person. He lives with his three children and his wife in a Choluteca community in the southern part of Honduras. His business is a small store.
  
René needs the loan to buy drinks, corn, bread, sugar, coffee, water, eggs, milk, beans, lard, etc. He hopes that this investment will help him a little to improve his and his family's quality of life. In the future, René hopes that his business will keep growing and that this investment he will make can make his store one of the best known ones in the area. 

René dreams of seeing his children and grandchildren become good people with better opportunities for society. 




Choluteca, Honduras –  Abril  del  2013

loans.use: to buy drinks, corn, bread, sugar, coffee, water, eggs, milk, beans, lard, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Shareef Park Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 38-year-old married woman living in Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. She is the mother of two children. Her husband provides white-wash and paint services for houses. Currently, he is in need of painting tools as his previous tools got damaged. Shazia is raising her hand in this picture. 

Shazia is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to buy paint in a variety of colors and paintbrushes for her husband's business. She is happy and glad to request this loan and hopeful that it will be productive for her family.

loans.use: to buy paint and brushes

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in hair dressing in Asamaso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Aba is single without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to provide more services. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to provide more services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married with four children. Although she has received no prior formal education, she is an entrepreneur who runs a chop bar in Asamaso, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Aba's husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Aba is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients and inventory to allow her to prepare and sell greater quantities of local dishes. In the long term, she plans to reinvest her profits into her business to help her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare and sell greater quantities of local dishes

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en:
Even though Nana Ekua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Nana Ekua is an entrepreneur. She sells groceries in Brasi (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Nana Ekua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her products. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that both her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married with four children, Her husband is a farmer. Due to difficult circumstances, Aba did not have access a formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. For the past year, Aba has sold sweet bread in Esiam, near Cape Coast. She uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Aba is requesting a loan to purchase an increased amount of ingredients to make sweet bread, which will aid her to improve her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make sweet bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint and waterproofer

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married with three children. Her husband works as a driver. Although she has received no formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooked rice in Asamaso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.
 
Ama wants to use her loan to increase her inventory, allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to sell greater quantities of rice

loans.name: Fredinard

texts.en:
Fredinard is married and has three children. He has received schooling through the middle school level. 

Fredinard has been selling soft drinks at Ve-Wudome, Hohoe, for 15 years. His wife is a petty trader. Fredinard uses his income to pay for the financial needs of his home. 

Fredinard will use the loan to purchase different types of soft drinks and other provisions to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Fredinard plans to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase different types of soft drinks and other provisions to sell.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Julián;  el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, el socio lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio ofrece los servicios de desayuno, almuerzo y cena, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “San Isidro de Yanahuara” communal bank. The bank is located in Urubamba district, Urubamba province and Cusco department, Peru.

The member's name is Julián. He splits time between his daily activities and his restaurant. Julián has been running his own business for several years and it is going well thanks to his determination. He offers breakfast, lunch and dinner at his restaurant. He is a responsible, diligent person who works hard to help his family get ahead. 

Julián is seeking this loan in order to buy rice, oil and meat among other ingredients.

He is pleased with the loan and is dedicated to making all his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and meat among other ingredients.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a petty trader who operates a small general store at Ve-Agbome, Hohoe. Beatrice has been educated until grade 6.  She is married and has two children with her husband, who is a driver. 

Beatrice has been selling for four years now. She supports her husband with some of the financial needs of the home and helps feed the family. Her loan will be used to buy machetes, earthenware bowls, pillows and plastic wares, thus allowing her to increase her sales. She plans to save her profits to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to buy machetes, earthenware bowls, pillows and plastic wares.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a fashion designer located at Ve-Wudome, Hohoe. She has received schooling but only to junior high school. Patience uses her income for all the general financial needs of her parents and herself.

Patience has been a seamstress for the past 12 years. She will use the loan to purchase linen, thread, cloth and zippers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Patience plans to save to acquire an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase linen, thread, cloth and zippers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour, oil, butter, bread, eggs, chorizo sausage, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a seamstress at Ve-Wudome, Hohoe. Vivian has received formal education to the junior high school level.  She is single with one child. 

Vivian has been a seamstress for four years now. She is responsible for providing for her household. Her loan will be used to buy thread, linen, sewing pins and needles, and cloth. She hopes to save and use the new profits from her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy thread, linen, sewing pins and needles, and cloth.

loans.name: Chanthon

texts.en:
Chanthon is 24 years old. She is married and lives with her mother in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has one child. 

To earn a living, she has been running a tailoring shop for more than four years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a mechanic who makes an income of $10 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Chanthon is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a walking tractor for rental. By doing so, she would earn additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and build a new house to live separately from her mother.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor for rental.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is divorced with four children. Even though she did not receive a formal education, Efua is a successful businesswoman. She sells local medicine in Asamaso (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. 

As the sole breadwinner, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use this loan to purchase ingredients to make more medicine to improve her overall sales. With profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make more medicine to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is divorced and has 5 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells Kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her Kenkey near Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for about 5 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Thav

texts.en:
Thav is 37 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 each day. 

In order to stabilize her family’s daily living, Thav is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a trailer to run public transportation. This purchase will help her earn additional income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer to run public transportation.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is involved in selling palm oil near Cape Coast. Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a farmer) support their 4 children. She has been involved in selling palm oil for 3 years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of palm fruits to make palm oil, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She wants to use her profits to better market her palm oil enterprise and to increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of palm fruits to make palm oil

loans.name: Reina Iris

texts.es:
La señora Reina tiene 44 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive  su hija quien le apoya en su actividad comercial. su negocio es servicio de sastrería y alta costura,  trabajo que realiza desde hace 14 años en la comunidad donde vive. 
Doña Reina su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico donde la fluidez de personas es grandes cantidades y esto hace que tenga mucha demanda por cada uno de sus clientes con los cuales trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo brindándoles sus servicios.
Doña Reina el crédito lo necesita para la compra de telas variadas, agujas, botones, hilos, mantas, zíper, etc. el impacto esperado con el crédito, es que su negocio crezca y le genere ganancias que le permita mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Reina los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio propio y ser uno de los mejores de su ciudad.



Choluteca, Honduras - Abril del 2013.
texts.en:
Reina is 44 years old. She lives in southern Honduras. She lives with her daughter, who helps her with her business activity. Her business is sewing and tailoring. She has done this work for 14 years in the community where she lives.
 
Reina's business is in a strategic place where a lot of people go by. This makes her have a lot of demand for each of her customers with whom she has worked a long time, offering them her services.

Reina needs the loan to buy various fabrics, needles, buttons, thread, muslins, sippers, etc. The impact she hopes to have with the loan is for her business to grow and generate income, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life a little. Reina's plans for the future are to keep growing in her own business and make it one of the best in the city.  



Choluteca, Honduras - April, 2013.

loans.use: to buy different fabrics, needles, buttons, thread, muslin, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is 35 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been doing carpentry for more than five years, earning approximately $8 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her business, Yan is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase timber to produce more tables, beds, and other furniture to sell. This purchase will help her obtain enough materials to use in the business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to produce more tables, beds and other furniture to sell.

loans.name: Nubia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Nubia tiene 52 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive  sus hijos y su esposo quien la apoya en  su actividad. Su negocio es venta de rosquillas y venta de producto variado,  trabajo que realiza desde hace 10 años en la ciudad donde vive. 
Doña Nubia su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez  de personas es en grandes cantidades, está en el centro de la ciudad y esto hace que sea muy visitada. el crédito lo necesita para la compra de rosquillas, dulces variado, espumillas, ajos, manzanillas, etc.
Doña Nubia el impacto esperado con el crédito, es que sus ventas crezcan, al tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y así satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de ellos.  
Doña Nubia los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio y ser uno de los mejores en su comunidad al mismo tiempo tener una mejor calidad de vida.




Choluteca, Honduras - Abril del 2013.
texts.en: Nubia is 52 years old and lives in southern Honduras along with her children and her husband, who supports her in her business. For the last 10 years, she has been selling a variety of products, such as "rosquillas" [donuts], in her community. Her business is strategically located in the city center where there is a lot of foot traffic. This is why she has so many customers. Nubia needs this loan to buy rosquillas, sweets, "espumillas" [meringues], garlic and chamomile tea, among other items, for her business. She hopes to increase her sales because of the loan. By having a wider variety of products, she will be able to satisfy each of her customers' needs. Nubia's future plans include growing her business and making it one of the the best in her community. She also wants to have a better quality of life. Choluteca, Honduras - April, 2013.

loans.use: to buy donuts, sweets, meringues, garlic, and chamomile tea, among other items, for her business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua grew up in poverty without an education but this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she is an entrepreneur who sells rice porridge in Esiam, near Cape Coast. Her business has grown substantially since she started a number of years ago. Efua uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their child. She has identified growing customer demand but is unable to meet it due to her limited inventory capacity. 

Efua is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to make and sell more rice porridge. With the profits from her loan, she wants to buck the trend by ensuring that her child will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase rice to make and sell more porridge

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 29 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged eight and six years. He runs a motorcycle transport business in Kapsabet town, from which he gets an average profit of KES 10,000 a month. He has been in this business for the last six years. 

Nicholas is now requesting a third loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD after successfully paying his previous loans. With this loan he intends to start a new business: purchasing green tea leaves from tea farmers for resale at a profit. He will use the anticipated profits from the business to expand it. His dream is to improve his standard of living and to have a stable, income-generating business.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua grew up in poverty without an education but this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she is an entrepreneur, running a general store in Esiam, near Cape Coast. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their eight children. Her business has grown substantially since she started it seven years ago. Ekua has identified growing customer demand but is unable to meet it due to her limited inventory capacity. 

Ekua is requesting a loan to purchase more products to sell. With the profit from her loan, she wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all of her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is an entrepreneur although she has received no prior formal education. For the past six years, she has worked selling groceries and soft drinks in Esiam, near Cape Coast. Aba is married with three children and her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Aba is requesting a loan to increase her inventory, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the profit from her loan, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preference.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and improve her sales

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married with six children. Her husband works as a farmer. Although she has no formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Brasi (near Cape Coast). 

Aba has been involved in this enterprise for a number of years. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Aba wants to use her loan to increase her inventory and sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Aba plans to put her profits back into her business to help her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to sell greater quantities of groceries.

loans.name: Eduardo Atilio

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Eduardo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eduardo trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, el cual atiende los fines de semana, Eduardo trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Eduardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de ropa para abastecer su negocio, así también realizará el mantenimiento general que necesita su taxi, de esta manera Eduardo tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 53, lives in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a keen desire to improve his lot in life. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources, and because of the need to work from a young age to help his parents, Eduardo was unable to study Mechanical Engineering in further education as he had hoped to. In his free time, Eduardo likes playing football with his friends and he sometimes cooks a delicious dish of ceviche to share with his family.

At his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Eduardo works as a taxi driver, offering transport services in his city. He also runs a small business selling clothes, where he works on weekends. Eduardo works every day and can do so for about 10 hours. He feels comfortable with what he does and believes that it is going well thanks to the friendly treatment he offers to others.

Eduardo is very grateful to Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that he will be able to buy a larger volume and variety of clothes to stock his business. He will also carry out the general maintenance that his taxi requires. In this way, Eduardo will have his working tool in the best conditions, which will enable him to continue working and making an effort to achieve his greatest day of having his own home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and upkeep his taxi.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 37 years old and a mother of four children, all of whom are currently studying in school. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling used clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 16,800 KES. 

Lilian was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and she is applying for her sixth loan of KES 50,000 to purchase additional used clothing needed for her business. She will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, help purchase food for the family and expand the current business. Lilian hopes to own her own boutique in the future so as to improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional used clothes to sell

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is an entrepreneur although she has received no prior formal education. For the past ten years, she has prepared and sold "banku," a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste. Araba sells her banku in Esiam, near Cape Coast. She is married with three children and her husband works as a farmer. Araba generally uses the profit from her business to help her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Araba is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize to increase her current inventory levels. Her loan will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty banku. In the long term, Araba plans to reinvest the profit from her loan back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and maize

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged 11 and 4 years.  He is a welder in Koibatek town and has been in operation for the past five years, earning an income of KES 16,000.

Mwangi has borrowed KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. This is his second loan; he repaid the previous one successfully. He wishes to purchase more stock of metal materials for his welding business so he can make steel doors and windows, among other things.The profits he earns will be used to pay school fees. His dream is to be successful in his business and live happily with his family.

loans.use: To purchase metal materials for his welding business.

loans.name: Myadagbadam

texts.en: Myadagbadam, 39, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She and her husband have been operating a block factory for five years, since they came to Ulaanbaatar from the countryside. They still raise livestock and sell diary products to local people. Her elder two children go to high school and the youngest son stays at home. She is requesting a loan of 4,300,000 MNT to purchase raw materials such as cement and pebbles in large quantities. Those materials will ensure her business's sustainable development. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who, together with her husband, came to Ulaanbaatar to improve he life.

loans.use: to purchase cement and pebbles.

loans.name: Robertina

texts.es:
La  señora  Robertina  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo y sus  hijos en una comunidad en el  sur de Honduras. 
Doña Robertina su negocio es  la  pulpería. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  manteca, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aguas, lechas, huevos, café, pan, galletas, churros, carnes, refrescos, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y a la vez poder atender mejor  a sus clientes.
Doña Robertina espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una de  las pulperías más grande y reconocidas de la zona.
Doña Robertina desea poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos para que  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	




Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Robertina is a responsible, honest and hard-working individual. She lives with her husband and children in a community in the South of Honduras. Robertina's business is a small grocery store. 

She requires the loan to purchase butter, rice, beans, sugar, water, milk, eggs, coffee, bread, biscuits, deep fried pastries, meat, soft drinks, etc. With the loan and the increased inventory available in her store, she hopes to increase sales and to be able to take better care of her customers. 

Robertina hopes to meet her basic needs and to improve her family's quality of life. She hopes her business continues to grow and that, in a few years, it becomes one of the largest and most well-known grocery stores in the district. Robertina also wants to continue supporting her children so that they grow up to be good people with better opportunities in life. 

Choluteca, Honduras - April, 2013

loans.use: to purchase butter, rice, beans, sugar, water, milk, eggs, coffee, bread, biscuits, deep fried pastries, meat, soft drinks, etc for her business.

loans.name: Corina Angelica

texts.es:
Corina es una mujer de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Corina no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Corina trabaja en el área de ventas de una tienda de artefactos de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de venta y atención al cliente, Corina trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Corina se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea tarrajear el cuarto de sus hijos, ya que al ser una casa de adobe tiene problemas con los insectos y arañas, de esta manera Corina desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Corina is a 35-year-old woman who lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and her five children who she loves and who are her driving force in life. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who, together with her husband, put all their efforts into getting the family ahead in life. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and because of the need to work from a young age to help her parents, Corina was unable to study Business Administration as she had hoped to. 

In her free time, she likes relaxing by watching the television, and sometimes she cooks a delicious dish of Lomo Saltado to share with her family.

At her own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Corina works in sales in a shop selling artifacts of the city. She carries out sales and customer care tasks. Corina works every day for approximately 10 hours and thinks that it is going well for her thanks to her excellent performance and for the friendly service that she gives to others.

Corina is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders, as it is thanks to the help given that she will be able to improve her home as she wants to plaster her children's room, because being an adobe house, it suffers from problems with insects and spiders. In doing so, Corina hopes to offer her family security and well-being. As such, she will be able to continue working and making efforts to achieve her greatest dream of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Yessenia Rubi

texts.es:
Yessenia es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que ha tenido de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Yessenia no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Locro para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yessenia trabaja en un negocio de venta de equipos y repuestos celulares, ella vende y brinda atención al cliente, Yessenia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás. 
Yessenia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, al cual le servirá de mucho para poder hacer sus trabajos e informes que envía a sus jefes supervisores, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Yessenia is a 20-year-old who lives in the city of Ica with her parents and brothers. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a keen desire to better herself. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources, and due to the need to help her parents, Yessenia was unable to pursue a professional diploma in Business Administration that she had hoped. In her free time, she likes listening to music and sometimes cooks a delicious dish of Locro to share with her family.

Upon her own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Yessenia works in a business selling mobile phone accessories and spare parts, she carries out sales and customer service tasks. Yessenia works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that it is going well thanks to her good performance and the friendly way she deals with others.

Yessenia is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it thanks to the help given that she will be able to buy a computer which she will use a lot to carry out her job and produce reports to send to her supervisors. In this way, she will continue working and making every effort to achieve her greatest dream of pursuing professional studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Neli

texts.en:
Despite her young age, Neli has been involved in agriculture for 16 years, running a farm in Taperavan, one of the small villages of Ararat region. Neli owns arable land upon which she cultivates tomatoes, working hard to gather a good harvest and sustain her family.

The mother of a little daughter, Neli and her husband do their best to earn enough income for the family. Because agriculture is the family's only source of income, she would like to expand her farming business and so has requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. The loan will give Neli an opportunity to increase the harvest and sell it locally.

As an enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s living conditions, Neli is sure that her hard work will result in the big farm of her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of her land

loans.name: Oyunkhand

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunkhand is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling casual clothes to local people at a trade centre since 2008 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her husband has been running a taxi service using his own car. Her elder daughter studies at university, while her younger daughter is currently studying at kindergarten and next year will enrol in elementary school. As her children are growing up, their needs are increasing so she and her husband have decided to launch a new business - purchasing livestock from the countryside and later selling it to local people. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 4200000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy cattle and sheep. If their first sale is successful, it will greatly improve their living standards. Mr Oyunkhand is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and sheep

loans.name: Eugenia Estrella

texts.es:
La clienta Eugenia vive en Guayaquil. Empezó su negocio de comida para tener mas ingresos en el hogar, poco a poco fue mejorando su negocio. También para generar mas ingresos ella comenzó con un negocio de venta de películas.  

Su trabajo lo hace cocinando para la venta y lo realiza con sus hijas. Es Casada su esposo es maestro albañil, tiene dos hijas que estudian en escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo va a comprar implemento de cocina para hacer mas . Su sueño es  hacer otro piso en su casa que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, comprar artefactos para la casa y viajar.
texts.en:
Eugenia lives in Guayaquil.  She started her food business in order to have more income for her household.  Her business was improving little by little.  Also, in order to generate more income, she started a business of selling movies.

She does her work by cooking food to sell, and she does this with her daughters.  She is married, and her husband is a master bricklayer.  She has two daughters, and they attend public school.

She will use the loan to buy kitchen utensils in order to make more.

Her dream is to build another floor onto her house, that her children finish their education, to buy household appliances, and to travel.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 32-year-old married woman with five children aged between two and 14 years old. She describes herself as a flexible person and she operates a farm in a rural area, where she produces maize, beans and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for six years and she describes her biggest business challenge as not having adequate capital for expansion. She will use the 5000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farm. This is her first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 38-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. Her husband owns a general store in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of products in his shop. He wants to offer more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and his savings as well. However, due to a lack of funds, he finds this difficult. Therefore, his wife Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband buy a variety of products, including flour, sugar, pulses (such as lentils, beans, and peas), rice and detergents. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products, including flour, sugar, pulses (such as lentils, beans, and peas), rice and detergents, for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Emilia Armandina

texts.es:
Emilia es una mujer de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Emilia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Cordero para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Emilia trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Emilia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea tarrajear, pintas y poner piso a su hogar, ya que vive en una zona muy húmeda y esto causa que mayor cantidad de salitre, de esta manera Emilia podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar.
texts.en:
Emilia is a 50-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona with her three children, whom she loves and are her main purpose in life.  She is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who decided to dedicate all her effort to getting her family ahead because she has always been both mother and father to her children.  Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and because she had to work from the time she was very young to help out her parents, Emilia never got to get the degree in business administration she wanted.  In her free time she likes to watch movies and sometimes cook up a delicious lamb stew with her family.

On her own initiative and with lots of determination and dedication, Emilia works as a field hand on a farm in her city.  She works every day for about eight hours and believes things are going well due to her good performance and kind treatment of others.  She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to improve her house; she wants to plaster the walls, paint, and lay flooring because she lives in an area of very high humidity, the main cause of residue.  With the improvements Emilia can provide more security and well-being to the family, so she'll keep working and striving to achieve her biggest dream--to have a grocery store in her house.

loans.use: improve her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a shelf and raw materials.

loans.name: Mend-Ayush

texts.en: Mr. Mend-Ayush, 57 years old, lives with his wife, two sons and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been working as a bus driver for many years and is experienced at driving long distances. His two sons both work at private companies. His elder son has worked as salesperson for two years and, using his savings, he has bought a minivan and begun rendering transportation services to local people. His daughter studies at high school. He is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to cover the costs of repairing fences and buying spare automotive parts.
