The fence repair will enhance the security of his property and set a visible boundary between households. The spare automotive parts will be used for his son's recently purchased minivan and, after the repair, the son’s transportation service will provide increased customer satisfaction. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who wants to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to repair fences around his land and purchase spare parts for his son's minivan.

loans.name: Furaha -Chanika Group

texts.en: Ngoi, who is in her late 30s, is married and has three children, who are still going to school. She has been running two types of businesses--selling cosmetics and Madiras (a type of Muslim dresses). She has been in these businesses for two years. She works from 10 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Ngoi's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to started selling cosmetics, and to buy more Madiras to sell, and she has repaid her loan successfully. She used the profit to contribute to the cost of buying food, to continue building her house, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more Madiras to resell. Her dream is to become an international businesswoman. Ngoi will share this loan with the Furaha-Chanika Loan Group, which consists of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more Madiras (a type of Muslim dresses) for resale.

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en: Maqsoodan is a 49-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business, selling plastic bottles, 12 years ago. Maqsoodan, as a member of two-person lending group, has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to increase his supply of plastic bottles, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. Maqsoodan wants to buy a sewing machine with the profits. She hopes that the loan will be helpful in her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's supply of plastic bottles, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad is an active woman with five children. Her husband has excellent embroidery skills, and she sells embroidered products in the market. This business is the only source of income for his family. His business is doing well, and the demand for the embroidered products is increasing day by day. Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a variety of embroidery products, such as fabric and packets of thread in a variety of colors, for her husband's business. She is hopeful that the loan will be helpful for the growth of her husband's business. Shamshad is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of embroidery products, such as fabric and packets of thread in a variety of colors, for her husband's business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is from Kapan town, where she lives with her husband. The couple is provided with retirement pension, but the pension they get is hardly enough for covering their daily costs. So, Laura and her husband are also involved in beekeeping.  They keep 10 colonies of bees, get high-quality honey and sell it in the local market.

Realizing that beekeeping helps them to have stable income during the month, Laura would like to expand her business. She has applied for this loan, which she will use to purchase colonies of bees and enlarge her business. The loan is important for Laura and her husband to get more honey, sell it, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more colonies of bees

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 25-year-old, married man. He describes himself as ambitious and determined. He operates a general store. His business is located in a populated area, and his primary customers are traders. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate capital for expansion.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to add rice, beans and maize to his stock. This is his first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add rice, beans and maize to his stock.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 50-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 20 years old to 26 years old. She describes herself to be creative and persistent. She operates a second hand shoes business where she sells the shoes at a profit. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy environment. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand the business. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add more shoes to her business. This is her third loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add more shoes to her business.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en: Shaista is an active woman with five children. Her husband has excellent embroidery skills and he sells embroidered products in the market. This business is the only source of income for his family. His business is doing well and the demand of his embroidered products is increasing day by day. Shaista has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a variety of embroidery materials, like fabric and packs of thread in a variety of colors, for her husband's business. She is hopeful that the loan will be helpful for the growth of her husband's business. Shaista is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of embroidery materials, like fabric and packs of thread in a variety of colors, for her husband's business.

loans.name: Langat

texts.en: Langat is a 29-year-old single man who describes himself as patient, focused, and trustworthy. He runs computer classes, where he trains people in how to use computers. He has been involved in this business for one year in an urban area and describes his biggest business challenge as not having adequate capital for expansion. He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan, which is his first loan from SMEP DTM, to purchase a computer. The anticipated profits will be used to upgrade his computer's hardware.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling oil and charcoal in Esiam (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Esi is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of oil and charcoal. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of sausages, smokies and brawn.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 18 to 35 years old. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a pig rearing business, in which she sells pork in Nyeri area. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy piglets in order to increase the amount of pork produced. This is her fifth successive loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy piglets in order to increase the amount of pork produced.

loans.name: Confidence Group

texts.en: Marie is the featured leader of this team of entrepreneurs. She is 38 years of age. She is a wife of a businessman and a mother of four children, three of whom are attending secondary schools. Marie sells items like toothpaste, soap, and batteries. She has been doing business for 10 years. With the help of this loan, Marie will buy more items, in bulk, like toothpaste, soap, and batteries, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy items in bulk, like toothpaste, soap, and batteries, to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a 59-year-old widowed woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 20 years old to 39 years old. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a green grocery where she sells tomatoes, onions, kale and carrots. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a market area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the  10,000 KES loan to add stock of tomatoes, onions, kale and carrots. She hopes in the future to buy a plot of land and put up rental houses. This is her fourth loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of tomatoes, onions, kale and carrots.

loans.name: Nayema Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Nayema Group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 1,500,000 SLL each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Alie is the featured leader of this group. Born in 1959, Alie is married and has 12 children. Alie is a carpenter and has been a professional carpenter for 22 years now. Alie has requested this loan in order to buy working materials, like planks, nails, etc., to produce a large number of furniture for sale.

loans.use: to buy working materials, like planks, nails, etc., to produce a large amount of furniture for sale.

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en: Sardar is 58 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a welder by profession, which is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase iron rods, sheets, and welding rods for making doors and windows. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Sardar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing iron rods, sheets, and welding rods. Sardar is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase iron rods, sheets, and welding rods for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 70-year-old widowed woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 28 to 40 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a business where she sells charcoal in Nyeri area. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to add stock of charcoal to her store. This is her third loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of charcoal to her store.

loans.name: Leonor Sandra

texts.es:
La clienta Leonor vive en Libertad. Empezó en el malecón de la playa haciendo trenzas para los turistas que visitaban el sector. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos y así comenzó a comprar material para hacer pulseras, trenzas, cadenas etc. Actualmente realiza su trabajo en las playas de salinas en la mañana, ofreciendo a los turistas las trenzas para el cabello, pulseras, cadenas que las hace artesanalmente.

Su dificultad es la distancia de su casa hasta la playa de salinas. Es soltero, no tiene hijos. Su sueño es tener su propio centro de artesanos de trenzas.

Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar hilos para hacer las trenzas y otros artículos para la venta y así obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Leonor lives in Libertad.  She started on the promenade of the beach by making braids for the tourists who visited the area.  Little by little, her income was improving.  That is how she started buying material to make bracelets, braids, and chains, etc.  

She currently works at the Salinas beaches in the morning.  She offers handcrafted hair braids, bracelets and chains to the tourists.  Her difficulty is the distance from her house to the Salinas beach.  She is single and does not have children.  Her dream is to have her own handcrafted braid center.

Therefore, she wants the loan to buy thread to make the braids and other items to sell.  She will do this to get more income.

loans.use: to buy braids.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 24-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates an m-pesa store where she sells phone accessories. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add stock of phone accessories for sale. Her business goal is to open another m-pesa shop within five years. This is her first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of phone accessories for sale.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a married man. He has three children between the ages of one and two years old. He describes himself to be aggressive. He operates a general store where he sells retail stock. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a market area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to add stock of sugar, salt, flour and fat. This is his second loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, salt, flour and fat.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 50 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. She belongs to a very poor family. Her husband has a stall, where he sells piper betel leaves, areca nuts and tobacco. This is the only source of income for his family. Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase areca nuts and tobacco, for his stall. This will help him to continue his business. Shamim is thankful to Kiva.

[Betel quid is a combination of betel leaves, areca nuts, and tobacco, sometimes with spices or other ingredients, which is chewed.]

loans.use: To purchase areca nuts and tobacco, for selling with piper betel leaves.

loans.name: Maycon Nan

texts.es:
Maycon es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Maycon pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Mecánica Electrónica, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Parrillada para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Maycon trabaja como técnico mecánico en una empresa automotriz de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días, puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Maycon se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar las paredes y ponerle piso de concreto a gran parte de su hogar, de esta manera Maycon podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica para poder conseguir un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Maycon, 26 years old, is single and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with his parents and siblings. He is a very kind, enthusiastic, and hard-working person with a desire to improve. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Maycon was able to study the technical career path of Electromechanics. In his free time, he likes to entertain himself by watching TV. Sometimes, he cooks delicious barbecue to share with his family.

From his own initiative, and with much determination and effort, Maycon works as a technical mechanic at an automotive business in the city. He works every day for up to 10 hours. He thinks it's going well due to his good performance and his friendly treatment toward everyone.

Maycon is very grateful for the Kiva loans. Thanks to the help they provide, he will be able to make improvements on his home. He wants to strengthen the walls and put a concrete floor in most of the home. This will allow Maycon to provide better security and well-being to his family. He will also continue working and making an effort to reach his dream of studying the professional career of Mechanical Engineering so that he can get a better job.

loans.use: to make improvements on his home

loans.name: Benduu Group

texts.en:
Meet this group of entrepreneurs from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 SLL for each group member, from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently, improve their standard of living.

The featured leader of this group is Wurie. Wurie is age 54; he was born in Tonkolili district. Wurie is married to a trader. He sells cloth/clothes and has been a businessman for 15 years, now. Wurie will use his share of the loan to buy a large quantity of cloth and clothes, to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cloth and clothes, to add to his current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts at wholesale prices, to add to his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Malaneh Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Malaneh Enterprise Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs, who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan. They requested 1,500,000 SLL for each group member, which they will invest in their respective businesses.

Kadiatu, who is pictured on the right, is the featured leader of this group. Kadiatu is 51 years old, and she is married and has three children. One of her children is still attending primary school, and the others are no longer attending school.  Kadiatu sells food at a market – for example, rice and palm oil. She has been doing business for 15 years. She has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of rice, palm oil, and other foods, to add to her inventory.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice, palm oil, and other foods, to resell at the food market

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is a young farmer from Tavush region. His farm currently includes 20 chickens and 7 pigs. He cultivates potatoes and grows different kinds of fruit trees (plum, cherry, apple, and pear).

As the only breadwinner of the family, Narek works hard to earn a good income. His family includes four people:  Narek himself, his wife, and his parents. In order to enlarge his farm, Narek has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, he will purchase two calves and forage for feeding them. This is important for him, to get a higher income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and wider variety of shoes.

loans.name: Ndovu

texts.en:
Ndovu is 41 years old, married, and the father of five children. For the last ten years he has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES. 10,000.

Ndovu was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer and is applying for his third loan of KES. 30,000 to buy seeds and some fertilizer. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for children as well as expand his farming activities.

His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is from Aghitu village of Syuniq region. She is married with one child and is engaged in agriculture. The region is famous for its severe cold climate and locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding. Lusine keeps livestock, which currently includes 70 sheep, 2 cows, and 10 chickens. She also cultivates wheat and potato and sells the gathered harvest locally.

The income Lusine gathers from farming business is hardly enough for covering family's basic costs. So, in order to improve her business and gather more income, she would like to expand her farm. Lusine has applied for this loan to purchase 15 sheep and wheat seeds for cultivation. The loan is important for Lusine to gather a high enough income to sustain her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep and wheat seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis has been involved in agriculture for 20 years. He earns his living by running a farm, which currently includes 3 cows, 5 sheep, 2 pigs, and 20 chickens. Sargis also owns arable land where he cultivates wheat and sunflower and sells the gathered harvest locally.

Sargis has a big family of seven (in the photo): Sargis himself, his wife, mother, son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. The whole family helps Sargis with running the farm and they work hard in order to gather good income. Having lots of experience in the agricultural field helps Sargis get high quality milk, meat, and other agricultural products to sell at local markets. The income from agriculture is the only one for the family, that's why it is very important for Sargis to enlarge his farming business.

He has applied to SEF Internation for a loan, which he will use for purchasing 5 oxen and wheat seeds for starting the cultivation process. The loan will help Sargis to increase his agricultural activity and have a profit. Sargis dreams of developing his farm so that his son will be able to get involved in agriculture and will be able to sustain his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for 5 oxen and wheat seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Mrgavet village of Ararat region. She has been engaged in agriculture for many years. Her farm currently includes 2 cows and a pig, as well as growing apricots, peach trees, and cultivating tomatoes. Anahit's husband sells the gathered harvest locally and gets income for the family. This income is very important for Anahit to sustain her family of 5: Anahit herself, her husband, and three children.

Realizing that agricultural income is very important for the family, Anahit would like to expand it. She has applied to SEF International for a loan. With the help of the loan she plans to purchase a cow, a calf, and fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation of the land.

The loan is very important for Anahit to enlarge her farming business and give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a calf, and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Alejandro  pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Asado de Pescado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alejandro trabaja en el área de soplado de una empresa industrial de su ciudad, adicionalmente los fines de semana brinda servicios de transporte en su mototaxi, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Alejandro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una moto lineal de segunda mano, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder transportarse hasta su centro de trabajo, ya que este queda en un lugar alejado, de esta manera el podrá ahorrar un poco de dinero y así poco a poco desea lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio taller mecánico.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a 38 year old man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and two children, whom he loves and are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person. He and his wife dedicate all their energy to getting their family ahead. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Alejandro was able to study to become a mechanic. In his free time, he enjoys preparing delicious grilled fish to share with his family.

At his own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Alejandro works in the glass blowing section of a local industrial business. In addition, on the weekend, he works as a mototaxi driver. He works approximately 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, and believes that this suits him because it has brought him success and the enjoyment of working with others.

Alejandro is very thankful to Kiva lenders. Because of their help, he will be able to buy a second-hand motorcycle, which he will use to drive to his remotely located work place. This will allow him to save some money and little by little help him achieve his dream of owning his own auto repair shop.

loans.use: Para la compra de una moto lineal de segunda mano

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, a petty trader in Wegbe, Hohoe, received no formal education. A married mother of four whose husband operates a drinking spot, she has been a petty trader for six years.

Charity will use this loan to buy ladies' tops, skirts, and panties. She hopes to use the new profits both for savings and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ladies' tops, skirts, and panties

loans.name: Katherine Cristabel

texts.es:
Katherine es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Katherine pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Katherine trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, adicionalmente producto de trabajos anteriores pudo comprar una mototaxi, la cual alquila a choferes para que brinden servicios de transporte, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Katherine se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como arena, cemento, ladrillos y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder construir una habitación en su hogar, de esta manera Katherine y su pequeño tendrán un lugar adecuado y seguro donde vivir, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ejercer como Enfermera en un hospital de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Katherine is a 25 years old. She lives in the city of Ica with her parents and her young son whom she loves an who is her main reason for living. She is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts all of her effort into getting her little one ahead. Thanks to her hard work and her parents' help, Katherine was able to study nursing. In her free time she likes to dance and sometimes cook a delicious Lomo Saltado to share with her children. 

On her own initiative, and with much hard work and dedication, Katherine works in her small business selling clothes for women, men and children. In addition, from previous jobs she was able to buy a motorcycle taxi. She rents it out to drivers so they can provide a transportation service. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and she thinks it is going well for her because of the good prices and the friendly way she treats others. 

Katherine is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, bricks and more. These will be used to build a room in her house. This way, Katherine and her little one will have a nice, safe place to live. She will keep working and striving to achieve her big dream of practicing as a nurse in a hospital in her city.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Bansah

texts.en:
Bansah sells engine oil at Ve-Wudome, Hohoe Lorry Park. Bansah has received basic education up to junior high school level.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is an auto mechanic. 

Bansah has been selling engine oil to motorists for the past three years. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy different types of engine oil. She hopes to save and use the new profits from her business to expand her working capital.

loans.use: to buy different types of engine oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has four children. She has not received any formal education. Elizabeth has been a petty trader at Ve-Wudome, Hohoe and its neighbouring communities for the past fifteen years. However, she has only been selling  porridge in the community for the past three years. Her husband is a farmer. 

Elizabeth uses her income to support her husband with other basic financial needs of the home. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase bags of maize and sugar. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and sugar.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married and has three children. She has received some schooling but only to middle school. Agnes is a petty trader who deals in the sales of unprocessed rice to sellers at Ve-Agbome, Hohoe. She has been involved in this trade for the past ten years. Her husband is a farmer and she uses her income to assist him with the basic needs of the home. 

Agnes will use the loan to purchase more bags of rice from the local growers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save to reinvest to enable her expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice from local growers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has five children. She has received basic education through middle school. Grace sells mother care products at Ve-Agbome, Hohoe, which she has done for the past nineteen years. Her husband is a local carpenter. Grace is responsible for clothing and feeding her children, therefore she uses most of her income to so do. 

Grace will use the loan to purchase more babies' clothes, soap, napkins, towels and pads, allowing her to increase her profits. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to save to enhance her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more babies' clothes, soap, napkins, towels and pads, allowing her to increase her profits.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Isha is a food vendor in Ve-Wudome, Hohoe. Isha has received education to the junior high school level.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Isha has been selling yams for six years now. She is responsible for the basic financial needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy oil, yam and charcoal. She hopes to save and use the new profits from her business to enhance her income.

loans.use: to buy oil, yams and charcoal.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married and has four children. He has received schooling up to the middle school level. Emmanuel has been a veterinarian officer at Ve-Wudome, Hohoe, for the past 25 years. His wife is a farmer. Emmanuel is responsible for all the financial needs of his family. 

Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase various types of veterinarian drugs. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to save to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase various types of veterinarian drugs.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Upon returning from two years of service in the army, Erik, at the age of 24, found a means to make a living by breeding cattle. He breeds 110 sheep and earns income. Due to his hard work, Erik has gained many loyal customers who prefer to buy beef and milk only from him. In order to expand his agricultural business, Erik would like to increase the variety of livestock he keeps.

Erik has applied for this loan to purchase eight calves and enlarge the cattle breeding business.  The loan is very important for Erik to be able to get high enough income and ensure better life for his family.

Erik lives with his mother and brother and is the only breadwinner of the family.

loans.use: to pay for eight calves.

loans.name: Imre

texts.ru:
Имре рабоатет государственным служащим в госэнегрокомпании. Стаж работы - 35 лет. Сейчас Имре делает внешний ремонт своего дома. Он утепляет стены, красит фасад, пристраивает крыльцо. Ему не хватает собственных сбережений, поэтому Имре просит кредит в размере 20,000 гривен, чтобы закончить ремонт стен.

Имре - заядлый рыбак и в свободное время он ходит на рыбалку. Пойманную рыбу он готовит сам и угощает своих друзей. Имре женат, есть один взрослый сын.
texts.en:
Imre is a state employee working for the state energy company. He has 35 years of work experience. At present he is in the process of making outside repairs on his house. He is insulating the walls, painting the façade, and adding a porch. His own savings are insufficient, which is why Imre is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 UAH, in order to complete wall repairs.

Imre is passionate about fishing and often goes fishing in his spare time. He cooks his catch himself and invites his friends for a meal. Imre is married and has a grown-up son.

loans.use: to insulate and paint the walls of his house.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida has been involved in agriculture. She lives in a small city called Jermuk in one of the beautiful regions of Armenia, Vayots Dzor. Aida lives with her three children and husband who works locally as a policeman. Unfortunately, his salary does not allow the family to live maintain their lifestyle and there are a lot of costs that the family can't cover. In order to help her husband to sustain the family, Aida started a bee-keeping business two years ago. She keeps 30 colonies of bees and a calf. Aida makes honey which she sells locally. As honey is must have item for each household in the region, there is a big demand for that. So, in order to meet current market demand and gather high income, Aida would like to increase her agricultural business.

Aida has applied for this loan to purchase ten bee colonies. Realizing that agricultural income is very important for her, Aida would like to enlarge her agricultural business and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for ten bee colonies.

loans.name: Ahmadiyya Traders Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Ahmadiyya Traders” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Hannah. Hannah was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. She is a widow with four children. Hannah has been a businesswoman for 25 years now. She sells market food: palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste) and other market food items. Hannah has requested a loan of SLL 500,000 in order to buy palm oil, margi etc. in large quantities to add to her business stocks.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, margi etc. in large quantities to add to her business stocks.

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Togetherness” group. They are small scale entrepreneurs, who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each member to invest in their respective businesses. 

Sheka is the featured leader of this group.  Sheka is a native of Lunsar, he is 45 years old. He is married to a trader and the couple has one child.  Sheka sells ready-to-wear clothing. He has requested this loan in order to buy clothes in large quantities to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy clothes in large quantities to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Maryuri Elizabeth

texts.es:
La clienta Maryuri vive en Guayaquil. Empezó a ver que por el sector no vendían bebidas y escogió esta actividad para que los que viven por el sector no caminen mucho para conseguirlas. En la actualidad sigue con su negocio las ventas las realiza con sus hijos y en diferentes horarios.

Su dificultad en su negocio es por la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde ella vive. No esta casada, tiene tres menores de edad que estudian en escuela fiscal.

Su sueño es terminar su otra casa que tiene, ver que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y crecer su negocio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar bebidas y poder asi tener mas variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maryuri lives in Guayaqil.  She started to see that drinks were not being sold in her area.  She selected this business activity so that those living in her area would not have to walk a lot to get drinks.  She currently continues with her business.  She makes the sales with her children and on different schedules.

The difficulty in her business is the crime that exists in the area where she lives.  She is not married.  She has three minor children, and they attend public school.

Her dream is to finish another house that she has, to see her children complete their education, and to grow in her business.  That is why she wants the loan to buy drinks and to be able to have more variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Ernesto Fernando

texts.es:
Ernesto es un hombre de 37 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Ernesto no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Eléctrica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia y amigos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ernesto trabaja como ayudante en una panadería de su ciudad, el se encarga de preparar panes y dulces, Ernesto trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ernesto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, ladrillos, arena  y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder mejorar una habitación deteriorada de su vivienda, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada.
texts.en:
Ernesto is a 37-year-old man.  He is single and he lives in the city of Ica.  He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to better himself.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and a need to work from a very young age to help his parents, Ernesto was not able to pursue the electrical engineering degree he wanted.  In his free time he likes to cook a delicious lomo saltado, or stir fried steak and onions, to share with his family and friends.  

On his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Ernesto works as an assistant at a bakery in his city.  He is in charge of preparing breaks and sweets.  Ernesto works every day for around 10 hours and he thinks it is going well because of his good performance and the friendly service he provides.

Ernesto is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to the help they have offered that he will be able to buy construction materials, such as cement, bricks, sand, and others, which will greatly help him to improve a deteriorated room in his home.  He will keep working and applying himself to achieve his great dream of having a safe and suitable home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Ndrek

texts.en:
Ndrek has been caring for his pigs and sheep in the rural north for almost ten years and he considers this activity as a profitable one. 

A loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek will help Ndrek to organize his animals stable; right know, all the animals live in an open concept stable, and he wants to separate the pigs from the sheep. This also will enable him to look after the animals better. 

“I don’t feed them with the same food, because they are not the same. At the same time, some of them require milking like the sheep, and some don’t, like the pigs. This is why I thought of opening more room to milk the sheep and separate their food and also separate them from one another.” Ndrek said.
 
What you see in the background of the photo is the actual stable.

loans.use: to organize his animals' stable and separate the pigs from the sheep.

loans.name: Lule

texts.en:
Lule loves animals and particularly cows.

 “I have been caring for them for almost seventeen years now and for sure my love for this kind of animal has grown throughout the years. My daily routine includes milking, feeding, cleaning up the stable, selling the milk and making homemade cheese. I prefer to make the cheese myself rather than selling the milk to the dairy farms. I gain more money like this,” Lule said.  

Lule is married and in her mid-fifties with two grown-up children who live in the North-Western part of the country. 

Lule wants to expand the existing animals’ stable and a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek, that she is requesting from Kiva lenders, will help her achieve the goal.

loans.use: to expand her animals' existing stable.

loans.name: Monica Gioconda

texts.es:
La clienta Monica vive en Duran. La cliente comenzó con su negocio para poder generar ingresos su familia y fue entonces que decidió vender bebidas gaseosas en su casa. 

Poco a poco a mejorado sus ingresos, no ha tenido ninguna dificultad por eso quiere continuar con su negocio y mejorar las bebidas que le da a sus clientes.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas gaseosas para poder tener mas ingresos y asi mejorar su casa ya que ahora es de caña.
texts.en:
Monica lives in Duran.  She started with her business in order to be able to generate income for her family.  It was then that she decided to sell soft drinks at her house.

Her income has improved little by little.  She has not had any difficulty.  Therefore, she wants to continue with her business and to improve the drinks that she gives her customers.

She wants to use the loan to buy soft drinks in order to be able to have more income.  This way she will improve her house that is now made from reeds.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks.

loans.name: Elva Marina

texts.es:
Elva es una mujer de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con sus esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Elva no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Asado de Pescado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Elva trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de raspadillas, ella prepara deliciosas raspadillas de frutas y las vende fuera de su vivienda, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes.
Elva se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como madera, clavos, pintura y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder mejorar el espacio que ocupa para vender sus raspadillas, de esta manera Elva brindara un mejor servicio a sus clientes, asi pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran brostería.
texts.en:
Elva is a 44-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and their four children, whom she loves and who are her main reason for living.  She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, along with her husband, puts all her effort toward getting her family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and a need to work from a very young age to help her parents, Elva was not able to pursue the nursing degree she wanted.  In her free time she likes to make delicious grilled fish to share with her family. 

On her own initiative and with a great deal of hard work and dedication, Elva runs her small business selling snow cones.  She makes delicious, fruit-flavored snow cones and sells them outside her home.  She works every day for around 10 hours and she thinks it is going well because of the good service she provides to her customers. 

Elva is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to the help they have offered that she will be able to buy construction materials such as wood, nails, paint, and others, which will be a great help in improving the space where she sells her snow cones.  This will allow Elva to offer her customers better service and she will keep working and putting her effort into achieving her great dream of having a big restaurant that sells fried foods.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El cliente Miguel vive en Duran. El comenzo con su negocio para darle una mejor oportunidad de ingresos a su familia, el hace artesanías y las vende en las escuelas y colegios a los estudiantes. También en ocasiones va las playas de Esmeraldas a vender para tener mas ingresos.   

No tiene dificultades por ahora, solo en su casa que es de madera y caña ya que tiene que cambiar el piso de su casa porque se esta dañando debido a que es de madera. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio, por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo hilos, tela para hacer sus artesanías y asi tener ingresos para arreglar el piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in Duran.  He started with his business in order to give his family a better income opportunity.  He makes handicrafts, and he sells them to students at elementary schools and high schools.  He also sometimes goes to the beaches in Esmeraldas to sell in order to have more income.

He does not have any difficulties now.  The only difficulty is in his house, which is made of wood and reeds.  He needs to change the floor of his house because it is damaged due to the fact that it is made of wood.

He has a lot of aspirations in his business.  Therefore, he wants to use the loan to buy thread and fabric to make his handicrafts.  This way he will have income to fix the floor of his house.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: Aqeel

texts.en: Aqeel is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a good and hardworking entrepreneur. He runs a bookshop, sells accessories and offers services to his clients. He started his business in partnership with his cousin. He managed the business well, so he bought his cousin`s share. He would like to expand his business to offer his customers what they need. So he has applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing small Xerox and print machines to increase his profit. He would like to get married and open a big stationery store to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy small Xerox and print machines to increase his profit.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single guy; he is one of five siblings in the family. Mohammad is a university student in his third year majoring in Banking and Finance. 

He is applying for an educational loan to pay the next semester's fees. After graduation he would like to find a job in the field of his studies to support himself and help the family financially too.

loans.use: to pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a 36-year-old married man, he is a father with one son and two daughters. All of his children are under 18 years old.

For the past 2 years, Ameen has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Ameen is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new engine to the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi capacity to work extra hours and enable Ameen to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

Ameen appears in Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to pay the cost of purchasing a new engine

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 38 years old and has a spare parts shop in Nairobi town. He has been in this business for 13 years, and it has been profitable. He is married to Esther and has three children.

This will be his third loan term with KADET LTD. He plans to use the amount to buy more stock of spare parts to sell. He will use the anticipated income to buy more varieties of spare parts.

He hopes to grow his business and open another spare parts shop. He also hopes to buy a plot and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Coyllorytti De Ccorao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORYTTI DE CCORAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Dionicia ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales como quinua, trigo y cebada, la socia vende en los diferentes mercados y ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien, la socia en sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender quinua, trigo y cebada. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar quinua, trigo y cebada.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the Señor de Coyllorytti de Ccorao Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Ccorao, which is in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

Bank member Dionicia is married, 42 years old, and has two children.  She has a business selling grains such as quinoa, wheat, and barley.  She sells at different markets and fairs, working from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has had her business for eight years and it is doing very well.  In her free time, she likes to go on walks with her children.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her quinoa, wheat, and barley.  She is asking for this loan to buy quinoa, wheat, and barley.

The other bank members have businesses selling animals, vegetables, groceries, and craftwork.  

Dionicia is thankful to everyone who has played a part in this dream and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, wheat, and barley

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old, married and a mother of two children. She lives in Kangundo town. She sells scrap metal to metal industries, and she has been in this business for the past six years. 

This is her second loan term. She plans to buy more stock of scrap metals to supply to the metal manufacturing industries. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to buy a pickup and be able to collect more scrap metal to sell.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal to sell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a cash crop farmer in Oloitoktok town, where she plants maize, beans, and vegetables to sell. She is 26 years old and married with two children. She has been in the farming business for two years. 

This is her second loan term with KADET LTD, and she plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. 

She hopes to generate more income so she can buy more land for farming, and plant more varieties of cash crops to sell.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a married man, age 40, blessed with five children between 3 and 12 years old.  He has a photography business which he has been  doing for 18 years, earning a monthly income of KES.15,000.

He is now servicing his sixth loan of KES. 65,000 from KADET LTD, and intends to use this amount to purchase a new camera for his business, and to pay school fees for his children.  

The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan, and for the welfare of his family.

His dream is to improve the living standards of his family, as well as expand his current business.

loans.use: To purchase a new camera, and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah has a business selling clothes in Nairobi town. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She has been in this business for the past 12 years.

This will be her third loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell. This will enable her to meet the demands of her customers, as well as to make more income which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business, and open a boutique and be successful in the clothing business.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 49 years old, married to Lydia, and both blessed with three children.  He has been in the butchery business for the last three years, with a monthly income of KES. 50,000.

He has applied for a business loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD, which he use to purchase livestock for slaughtering. 

Robert will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. Robert hopes and dreams of expanding his business, educating his children, and increasing income to his family.

loans.use: To purcase livestock for slaughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase modern cleaning machines, detergents, brushes, and brooms.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is single, a 28-year-old pharmacist. He has been a chemist and running his clinic for the past seven years.  He has a monthly income of KES. 36,000, which he uses for his upkeep and that of his siblings. Jacob is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. 

Jacob will use the loan to buy more medicines and upgrade his clinic. He will plow the anticipated profit back into the business to realize even more profit. 

His hope and dream is to run a stable and modernized clinic.

loans.use: to buy more medicines and upgrade his clinic.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old, married, and blessed with five children. She is a small scale horticulture farmer in Kapsabet town; this has been her income generating business for the last three years.  She gets an average monthly profit of KES.10,000 from this business. 

She has borrowed her first loan of KES. 30,000.  She intends to purchase green tea leaves from farmers, and sell it to a tea factory for a profit. Veronica anticipates getting additional profits by buying a piece of land to grow more tea. 

Veronica hopes to improve her living standards, and save money to pay school fees for her children.  

She also wants to start a new business to diversify her source of income.

loans.use: To purchase tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejorar sus situaciones económicas y sacar adelante a sus familias, son personas amables y gentiles que mantienen su buen humor y las costumbres de su pueblo. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar goza de mucha vegetación y de verdes paisajes, está rodeada de montañas que le dan un toque muy especial.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, es la presidenta del banco comunal Nueva Ilusión, forma parte de este hermoso grupo de amigas hace algún tiempo en el cual ha llegado a fortalecer lazos de amistad con todas compañeras. 

Doña Ana tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos que tienen 27, 21, 18, 11 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos de la casa.

La Señora Ana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, pero para sacar adelante a su familia cría y vende cuyes, cerdos y ganado a los cuales los vende en su comunidad, también trabaja en la agricultura y lo que produce es para el consumo de su hogar, en las tardes se dedica  a la venta de tamales y café en su casa, todas estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de mejorar la estabilidad de su hogar y sacar a sus hijos  adelante, le gusta mucho el trabajo del campo porque pasa en casa y no se descuida de su hogar.

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtio en la compra de alimento para animales y productos para realizar sus tamales de los cuales obtuvo muy buenas ganancias y pudo solventar muchos gastos de su familia. Esta repitiendo el crédito para comprar más cerdos, cuyes y víveres para el negocio de la venta de cafés y tamales. 

La banca comunal le gusta porque los créditos le permiten invertir en su negocio y continuar creciendo.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Nueva Illusión communal bank is made up of eight ladies and one gentleman who work at different activities which allowed them to improve their financial situations and get their families ahead.  They are gentle and friendly people who keep good moods and their peoples' traditions.  They live in the Cumbe en Cuenca parish, and this area enjoys much vegetation and green landscapes.  It's surrounded by mountains, which gives it a special touch.

Ana is one of the members.  She serves as the president of the Nueva Ilusión communal bank and is a part of this group of friends which has formed strong friendship ties with her fellow members.

Ana is 44 years old and is the single mother of five children, ages 27, 21, 18, 11 and 9.  Her two oldest sons work and help her financially.  Her next oldest attends high school and her two youngest attend the local school.  She doesn't have a home of her own and lives with her mother and helps her with the household expenses.

Ana is a housewife but she raises and sells Guinea pigs, pigs, and livestock in order to get her family ahead.  She sells the animals within her community, and also works in agriculture and her products are for her family's consumption.  In the evenings she sells tamales and coffee from her home.  All these activities provide her the opportunity to improve her family stability and get her children ahead.  She likes to work in the fields very much because she can stay home and the home does not deteriorate.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy animal feed and ingredients for her tamales, from which she obtained some good earnings that she used to pay the household expenses.  She is asking for another loan so she can buy more pigs, Guinea pigs, and ingredients for her coffee and tamale business.

She likes the communal bank because the loans allow her to continue growing her business.  The small picture is of a member who was not able to attend when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 40 years old. She is a single mother of seven. Emily runs a retail shop. She has been in business for the last 10 years and makes an average income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) a month.

Emily has requested a loan of 60,000 KES, her fourth loan with KADET Ltd., after repaying well her previous loan. With this loan, she intends to purchase sugar, maize flour, beans and wheat flour to restock her business.

Emily plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and build a house for her family. Her dream is to expand her business and build a business premises to house her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 39 years old, married and the mother of five children. For the last 15 years, she has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Julia was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer and is applying for her sixth loan of 25,000 KES to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for her business. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her farming activities. Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view to increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs needed for her farming activities

loans.name: El Kuychy Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL KUYCHY”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es  el señor  Juan, el socio tiene 45 años de edad,02 hijos y es conviviente; él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 06:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente, , el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en la compra de llantas.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, venta de carne, venta de golosinas, venta de chicha blanca, mecanico, tienda de abarrotes.
El socio que aparece en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the "EL KUYCHY" communal bank, located in the San Sebastian district, in the Cusco province and department.

Juan is 45 years old, married, and has two children.  He provides taxi services and has been doing this for several years and things are going well for him, thanks to the effort he puts into his business each day.  He works Monday through Friday from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm and he is a responsible and hardworking person who gets his family ahead in this manner.

He is asking for a loan so that he can perform maintenance on his car, such as buying tires for it.

The other members have businesses such as selling clothing, meats, snacks, chicha, mechanic services, and grocery store.

The member who appears in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late for the meeting because of a work commitment.  Our member is grateful to those who form part of this dream and is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Gulaya

texts.en:
Gulaya is 61 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Jabrayil refugee. She is very kind and caring and very energetic in her work. 

Gulaya raises cattle, fattens them, and sells them for a profitable price. Her husband is the major support for her in this business. She sells the meat at the central bazaar for a profit. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat because it is used in a lot of meals such as kufta (soup), kebabs, dolma, etc. Her income from this business is 100 AZN per month. In order to fully support the family, Gulaya is looking forward to expanding the business and making it a very successful one. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,900 AZN from Aqroinvest Credit Union to buy more calves. This is her first loan. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 43 years old, married and supporting five people. He runs a business selling fish in Muhoroni. He has been in this business for the last 18 years and makes an average monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Thomas has requested a loan of 45,000 KES. He intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children and also add more stock of fish to sell. He anticipates profits, which he will use to purchase a refrigerator to preserve fish as well as expand his business. Thomas's dreams and hopes are to educate all his children to university level and open a hotel [restaurant] in his town.

loans.use: To pay school fees and also add more stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarantuya, 41 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her husband has the position of supply manager for a private company. Her daughter studies at university and her son goes to high school.

Mrs. Sarantuya has been running a grocery store for three years, and, during that time, she has accumulated a vast amount of experience in the sales field. Recently, due to lack of cash, her business profit decreased, as her goods reserve declined drastically. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 tugriks to purchase foodstuffs in large quantity. As a result, she can continue to sell foodstuffs without worrying about an inventory shortage. This borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs in large quantity for her grocery store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 43-year-old business lady who is married to John, a businessman. They are blessed with five children who are 21, 18, 16, 11 and 5 years old, respectively. Margaret has been selling clothes for the past 12 years with a monthly income of KES 34,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Margaret is applying for her second loan after repaying the previous loan very well. She will use the loan to buy more shirts, trousers, skirts and dresses for sale. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her business. 

Her hope and dream is to open a wholesale outlet.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, trousers, skirts and dresses

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
El cliente Jose vive en Libertad. Lleva 5 años en su negocio de venta de chifles (platanos en rodajas) empezó junto a su hermano pero en el poco tiempo decidió que se iba a independizar ya que era mas rentable. En la actualidad trabaja haciendo chifles y vendiéndolos todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta las 14h00.

Su dificultad es que no tiene medio de transporte y el sector que es muy peligroso. Si está casado su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio, tiene 4 hijos de 5 años, 1 año, 13 años y 14 años. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar plátanos para poder hacer mas chifles y vender a mas compradores y tiendas y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José lives in Libertad. For five years he has been in the business of selling plantain chips. He started the business with his brother, but in a short time he decided he was going to go out on his own, as it was more profitable. Currently he works making plantain chips, and selling them every day from 5 a.m. to 2 p.m. 

His challenge is that he doesn't have a means of transportation, and this area of the city is very dangerous. He is married and his wife helps him in the business. He has four children, ages 1, 5, 13 and 14. 

His dream is to improve his quality of life. That is why he wants the loan to buy more plantains, so that he can make more chips, sell to more customers and stores, and improve his income.

loans.use: To buy plantains.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence, now 32 years old, used his previous loan to expand his mobile phone business. He bought phones to sell, and it has been profitable. Besides the mobile phone business, he also sells electronics, such as radios and television sets.

This being his third loan term with KADET Ltd., Lawrence plans to use this loan to buy more stock of electronics, such as radios and television sets. He will also buy more stock of phones and phone accessories, which include phone batteries, chargers and phone covers, as well as memory cards. He will use the anticipated profits to open another electronics sales business. He hopes to become a supplier for electronics to various traders in the area.

loans.use: To buy electronics, phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: Iris Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Iris  tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo que depende de ella, su actividad es la venta de abarrotería, cuenta con una pequeña pulpería que tiene desde más de 15 años.
Doña Iris tiene muy buena clientela en su mayoría los vecinos de su aldea y personas en transitan por su domicilio su negocio está ubicado contiguo a una clínica médica lo que le permite vender sus productos a los pacientes que vienen de zonas rurales  que buscan asistencia médica. 
Doña Iris está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, quesos, café, manteca, pan, harina, refrescos, aguas, etc.  Espera que con esta inversión que realice le contribuya a tener una mayor existencia de producto, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Iris su sueños es contar con un local más apropiado para darle un mejor apariencia a su negocio y mayor comodidad a sus clientes al momentos de hacer sus compras,  mejorar las condiciones de vida y engrandecer mas su negocio.
Doña Iris con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo espera le contribuya a que sus sueños se hagan una realidad. 



Danli, Honduras  - Abril del  2013
texts.en:
Iris, 55, is married and has a dependent son. She sells groceries and opened a small store more than 15 years ago. Iris's many customers are mostly neighbors and people who pass by her house, which is located next to a clinic. She sells merchandise to patients that come in from rural areas seeking medical care.

Iris has applied for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, cheese, coffee, margarine, bread, flour, sodas, water, and more. This investment will help her stock more inventory, thereby increasing her income to cover household expenses and financial commitments. Iris dreams of having a better store that is more appealing and more comfortable for her customers, of improving her living situation, and of expanding her business. Iris hopes that the loan will help make her dreams a reality.

Danli, Honduras  - April 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, cheese, coffee, margarine, bread, flour, sodas, water, and more for her business.

loans.name: Las De La Unidad 2 Group

texts.es: Las de la unidad 2 son un grupo pequeño, integrado por mujeres que les gusta salir adelante y muy unido, además de que son muy puntuales con sus pagos. Sonia es una de sus integrantes, es una joven mujer de 26 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 9 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales para el cuidado de la salud y el crédito la ayudará a comprar mas producto. Sonia quiere a corto plazo tener un club de nutrición, para tener mas clientes y poder superarse.
texts.en: Unidad 2 is a small group, made up of women who like to get ahead and are very united.  They are also on time with their payments.  Sonia is one of the members.  She is a 26 year old young woman in a common law marriage and with a nine year old son.  She sells natural health products and this loan will help her buy mor products.  Sonia wants to start a nutricion club in the short term so she can have more customers and succeed.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco,la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia continua dedicandose a la agricultura ,la socia lleva años dedicandose a esta actividad la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma serguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Agripina lives in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco and belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Huanca” of Asociación Arariwa. She continues to farm as she has done for years, and things are going well thanks to her daily hard work. She wishes to keep working this way to support her family.

Agripina has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for her small farm. She thanks those who are supporting her dream and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her small farm.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 61-year-old farmer who is married to Rosemary and blessed with two children. Francis has been practicing farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. Francis will use the loan to purchase dairy cows to start supplying milk to his neighbors. 


With the expected profit from the sales, he will invest back in his business by purchasing more dairy cows. His hopes and dreams are to excel in dairy farming and horticultural farming.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows to start supplying milk

loans.name: Nolvia Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Nolvia, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada no tiene hijos, su actividad es la venta de ropa, calzado, ropa interior, electrodomésticos y enseres de cocina,  cuenta con más de 14 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad generadora de ingresos.
Doña Nolvia tiene muy buena clientela en su mayoría los vecinos de su barrio y de aldeas vecinas y personal que labora en las fábricas de la ciudad de Danli, a los que les visita en su domicilio.
Doña Nolvia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de sombras, polvos, glases, blusas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, blúmeres, braseares, etc. con el crédito espera le contribuya a tener una mayor existencia de producto, lo que le permitirá mejorar un poco sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Nolvia su sueños es contar con un local más apropiado para darle un mejor apariencia a su negocio y que los clientes se sientan cómodos al momentos de hacer sus compras,  mejorar un poco su  condicion de vida y engrandecer mas su negocio.
Doña Nolvia con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo espera que sus sueños se hagan una realidad, 



Danli, Honduras - Abril  del 2013
texts.en:
Nolvia is 43 years old, married, and has no children.  She works selling clothing, shoes, underwear, household appliances, and kitchen supplies.  She has been earning income from this work for more than 14 years.  Nolvia has a good customer base, the majority of whom are residents of her neighborhood and others nearby as well as people who work at the factories in the city of Danli who visit her home.  

Nolvia is requesting this loan to purchase shadows, powders, glasses, blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, underwear, bras, and other items.  She hopes that the loan will allow her to have more products available, which will allow her to improve her income to cover her family expenses and financial commitments.

Nolvia's dream is to have a more appropriate store to give her business a better appearance so that she can enlarge the store, improve her quality of life, and so that her customers feel comfortable while shopping.  Nolvia hopes that she will be able to make her dreams a reality with the support she receives from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase shadows, powders, glasses, blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, underwear, bras, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Xiomara Deyanira

texts.es: Xiomara Deyanira, 33 años de edad casada con un hijo mejor de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en General como: venta de cosméticos, ropa de adulto, niños, zapatos, sandalias, ropa interior prendas de oro entre otros ella realiza sus compras en Managua al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da al crédito a trabajadores de portuaria y los recuperas quincenal, ella vende de forma ambulante y en su casa de domicilio ella inicia su negocio con dinero propio, Xiomara es una mujer es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, que ha tenido que luchar desde muy joven para salir obtener su alimento diario, Por tanto lucha día a día para brindarle un mejor futuro a su pequeño hijo.
